Event.title: KB4 Interview
Event.descriptionHtml:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto!

In this one, we'll talk about KB4 Interview

You will be in a zoom chat alongside with 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or, Steward.

Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community

If you may serendipitously miss your interview, please do not fret and take a deep breath! You'll be able to reschedule it, we promise.

Event.title: Lets Play KERNEL Gaming Fridays!
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join in the virtual space to play games solo, in pairs or in a large group! Let's explore the trust spaces between us, or let's just hangout for a fun chat :coffee:

Note: Location can only be joined via laptop/PC.

One amongst the many available games is "Among Us" which would require an app to be installed in your phone, download here:

  • Android
  • iOS

Event.title: Indigenous Critique for Web3 Models
Event.descriptionHtml:
Women's Freedom: Web3 Innovation & Autonomy

Extension of Indigenous Dialogue

We would love to extend the dialogue on the 'new science' put forward by Graeber, Wengrow and Kernel's own Andy Tudhope. We'd also love to bring the matrilineal Kanienkahaka of the Five Nations Longhouse Confederacy into our Kernel conversations. This will bring us some real-time indigenous critique & dialogue as we move forward in web3 models of community organization and tech innovation.

Event.title: Token Communities
Event.descriptionHtml: Collaborate with your peers to map and visualise token economies you’re interested in learning more about. Hosted by Reuben from IDEO and Michael from KB4 and HERE, this guild votes on tokens or economies we’d all like to understand better and then spends their sessions co-creating Figma boards which, through better questions, literally map the flows of value in each system. Occasionally special guests will join in the fun, but the focus is always on shared sense-making.

Event.title: Generative Art and AI Storytelling with LORE
Event.descriptionHtml:
Something fun for those interested in the intersection of art + storytelling + AI + NFTs. My friend James runs Lore and my partner helps out with a lot of their community stuff, so I get involved pretty often as well. Lore has been a source of creativity, wonder, admiration, and delight for me, so I wanted to share it with the KERNEL community. Full context here: https://kernel-community.slack.com/archives/C016X4LLD9T/p1646425783957819

If generative art or AI are your jam, come hang out. We'll most likely spend the hour writing a collaborative story that reflects our experience as KERNEL fellows -- and see if Disco Diffusion can make sense of it all. :)

Event.title: [Guild] Movement with Cheryl
Event.descriptionHtml:
Yoga session with Kernel community led by Cheryl Davison, hosted every Monday at 12:30PM EST.

This class uses intentional movement and breathwork to help cleanse the body, calm the mind, build body awareness and strength, and lengthen muscles.

A typical class will feature 20-30 minutes of the Melt Method, and 20-30 minutes of yoga (vinyasa, beginner-intermediate).

Open to Gitcoin core team and Kernel community.

Event.title: Wellness x Good x Web3
Event.descriptionHtml:
Wellness + Good + Web3 + Gaming

Toby & I are proposing a conversation broadly around wellness, good and web3. Some initial thoughts.

  • introducing calm to the broader space

  • nft’s as representation of positive values or how can introduce ideas like flexing values like altruism rather than financial value

  • mindfulness and slowness in web3

  • web3 and mental health / XR + emerging tech and gaming

  • any other things related please bring along

Event.title: Web3 PMs 🌱 Product best practices
Event.descriptionHtml:
Exploring product management in web3 - where there's more ambiguity than data.

Lenny and 0xShah's recent post on "A product manager’s guide to web3" garnered a lot of interest. The post touched upon the unique attributes of web3 PMs, advantages/disadvantages and making the transition.

In this junto, we'd like to explore the more tactical side as a product manager in web3. At a high level, we will discuss:

  1. Best practices as a PM in web3

  2. Full spectrum product execution (research -> shipping)

Event.title: Outsmarting Contracts
Event.descriptionHtml:
Write your own production-ready NFT contract and learn about trade-offs, the real poetry of cooperation, and how to build Babel with mirth. Intended for developers just starting to learn about web3.

We will be running through a smart contract course created by OpenZeppelin, the team responsible for writing the most widely used and trusted smart contract libraries, and also one of the most respected audit and security firms in web3.

This guild is intended mostly for people who have never seen a smart contract before. It's not going to make you into a shadowy super coder, but it is going to introduce you to how networks like Ethereum actually work and uncover many of the more subtle aspects which are often skipped over in glib media pieces about the 'future of money' or whatever other attention-grabbing title works best in that days A/B test.

There will be four lessons, and each will last for ~2hours, as the intention is to have a lot of space for shared explorations, questions, and a calm approach to learning about a new world.

Event.title: NFTeasy
Event.descriptionHtml:
Write your own production-ready NFT contract and learn about trade-offs, the real poetry of cooperation, and how to build Babel with mirth. Intended for developers just starting to learn about web3

Everybody and their pet penguin has an NFT project these days. This is one of the features of open and permissionless technology: it’s wonderful until everyone starts using it, at which point it immediately feels overwhelming. But don’t grieve, dear heart, nor fear the seeming: here is waking in the dreaming.

We’ll run through the tools you need to start writing your own contracts and consider whether it’s even interesting at all to create non-fungible digital items. This will not immediately make you into a shadowy super coder, but it will give you the skills and knowledge to understand, analyse and navigate the less fungible and supposedly more permanent parts of web3.

There will be four lessons, and each will last for ~2hours, as the intention is to have a lot of space for shared explorations, questions, and a calm approach to learning about a new world.

Read more here

Event.title: Privacy and Self-Sovereignty in Emergent Worlds Part 2
Event.descriptionHtml:
Please join us for part 2 of the privacy and sovereignty adventure. I'm allocating two hours to meet this time since we went overtime the first meeting.

Please come prepared with:

  • Takeaways form articles #1 and #2 about cognitive consent

  • What you think a north star for our project could be, indexing against the below ("the best possible world")

  • What the product of our jam should be

The Task Ahead

Build and disseminate a new framework for privacy-enhancing technologies and data security standards commensurate to the task of managing and protecting privacy in blockchain-based technologies, the metaverse, and emergent environments.

To aid you in determining whether you have the right level of interest, bandwidth, and giveafark for this adventure, I elaborate three possible versions of what we might accomplish, below:

  • A pretty darn good world: The framework we develop is sufficiently detailed, well-researched, and technically feasible, but only in theory. We have not battle-tested it with enough protocols, games, and token developers to feel confident just yet.

  • An even better world: The framework we develop is sufficiently robust, well-researched, and technically feasible. It is immediately actionable by a broad spectrum of protocols, games, and token developers who gave us input.

  • The best possible world: The framework we develop is sufficiently robust, well-researched, and technically feasible. It is immediately actionable by a broad spectrum of protocols, games, and token developers who gave us input AND several of them have signed on to implement our framework.

❗Caveat (You Are Welcome And Needed Here!)

This is not a project that is only for engineers and cryptographers. I’m neither. Privacy is a citizen issue. It’s a legal and compliance challenge, an ethics challenge, an education and coalition-building challenge just as much as it is an engineering challenge. So please, if you care about building human-first tech and don’t want a Cambridge Analytica redux, we need writers, interviewers, organizers, coordinators, educators, and planners as well as engineers, cryptographers, and privacy researchers.uttons above for basic styling.

Event.title: Changing Face of Profit
Event.descriptionHtml:
Creatives and social entrepreneurs often encounter the question: “if you have passion / doing this for a good cause, then why do you want to make money?”

This junto aims to explore how the idea and mindset towards profitability is changing with the mechanisms that web3 affords, referring to existing initiatives that serve as examples. How does this allow business models to be more creative? We’ll also be discussing and ideating “so what”s to these new affordances: is mainstream or even crypto culture, aka “L-0”, able to accept, live and develop with these new mindsets? What are the challenges, and more importantly, how do we make things work?

I’m hosting this junto to open a discussion space; I don’t have the answers, but hope to be able to draw energy towards this topic and learn from one another!
Event.descriptionText:
Creatives and social entrepreneurs often encounter the question: “if you have passion / doing this for a good cause, then why do you want to make money?” 

This junto aims to explore how the idea and mindset towards profitability is changing with the mechanisms that web3 affords, referring to existing initiatives that serve as examples. How does this allow business models to be more creative? We’ll also be discussing and ideating “so what”s to these new affordances: is mainstream or even crypto culture, aka “L-0”, able to accept, live and develop with these new mindsets? What are the challenges, and more importantly, how do we make things work?

I’m hosting this junto to open a discussion space; I don’t have the answers, but hope to be able to draw energy towards this topic and learn from one another!

Event.title: Outsmarting Contracts
Event.descriptionHtml:
A shared journey through Ethernauts, intended for non-developers, in which we will explore the deep magic of web3

We will be running through a smart contract course created by OpenZeppelin, the team responsible for writing the most widely used and trusted smart contract libraries, and also one of the most respected audit and security firms in web3.

This guild is intended mostly for people who have never seen a smart contract before. It's not going to make you into a shadowy super coder, but it is going to introduce you to how networks like Ethereum actually work and uncover many of the more subtle aspects which are often skipped over in glib media pieces about the 'future of money' or whatever other attention-grabbing title works best in that days A/B test.

There will be four lessons, and each will last for ~2hours, as the intention is to have a lot of space for shared explorations, questions, and a calm approach to learning about a new world.

Read more here
Event.descriptionText: A shared journey through Ethernauts, intended for non-developers, in which we will explore the deep magic of web3

Event.title: An Active Inference Ontology for Decentralized Science
Event.descriptionHtml: This will be an interactive discussion on some recent work that uses Active Inference as a framework for modeling and sensemaking in complex epistemic ecosystems, for example related to DeSci and DeSchool. https://zenodo.org/record/6320575 . No familiarity with any specific topic is required. This conversation is open to everyone who would like to learn, contribute, or collaborate in any way. We'll have great times discussing what AEOS is, and how it might play a role in different communities and contexts.

Event.title: Web3 Funding - Jam 1
Event.descriptionHtml:
For all who are keen to learn -- and share -- about web3 funding structures and processes, and how they may differ from traditional VC funding.

This is the first jam of more to come, so the goal for this session would be to establish 1) a consistent group 2) a set of content that would be covered in jams to come 3) format(s) of the jams (zoom + excalidraw or miro or?)

Collecting questions here: link. Feel free to pitch in!

Event.title: Basic income
Event.descriptionHtml:
Let's talk about

  • benefits and downsides of basic income in society

  • your own experiences of hard time to pay the bills, or finish a project without having money, or having a side job for food security and in contrast your experiences of having a regular income

  • existing solutions in web3 

  • new ideas that you might have

Event.title: Fiction-setting the narrative. Snow Crash and other thoughts
Event.descriptionHtml:
With all the talks of fiction

And how it is human kinds greatest tool/innovation, I was thinking--why not write a book based on Kernel vision of the future? What would it really look like?

I just finished Snow Crash by Neal Stephenson and was amazed at how many of the things he nailed down in 1992. Given all the amazing discussions occurring in Kernel, this is ripe grounds for a talented Sci-fi author to craft an amazing author and perhaps help spread the world of Web3 and capabilities. Heck-Kernel would be an awesome ground for a Netflix/YouTube documentary series.

Are folks interested in talking about Sci-fi and story crafting the future of Kernel. Perhaps we could figure out who Satoshi Nakamoto is as well... I have a funny theory to share. . .

Kudos to those who could invite Neal Stephenson or Ted Ching to the conversation.

Event.title: Zodiac & DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
Explore open tools and new kinds of multichain collaboration within and between DAOs. This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

This build guild is intended as a deep dive into a future where we co-develop open tools for more valuable collaboration. In order to do that, we'll start by going all the way back to the beginning of cooperatives and beyond. Everyone is welcome to join this first conversational session, which will introduce the above and explore the possibilities for culture in The Guilded Age.

In Sessions II, III and IV, we'll be taking a selected group of people through Zodiac: what it is, how to use it, and how to build new stuff for everyone with it. The only criteria for joining this session is that you must be willing to teach others in your block what you learn by hosting your own session at some stage. This is how p2p learning propagates.

Read more here

This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

Event.title: Co-Designing Community Live-In Gardens
Event.descriptionHtml:
Around the globe families are being separated. Homes are being destroyed. Indigenous land is being exploited and underdeveloped.

Let’s design a new reality beyond the limits of geopolitical borders

How can cryptographic technology connect separated families? How can we coordinate to protect nature? How can we create systems for refugee communities? How can we develop neglected spaces?

***This is a creative space. Please bring your imagination and your most intelligent heart.

Event.title: Communities Creative spaces and the initiation of open-ended token design around it.
Event.location: To join the video meeting, click this link: https://meet.google.com/wyx-yrpe-pfg Otherwise, to join by phone, dial +1 413-418-2192 and enter this PIN: 403 763 761# To view more phone numbers, click this link: https://tel.meet/wyx-yrpe-pfg?hs=5
Event.descriptionHtml:
In our last junto we discussed communities and various aspects related to communities, nurturing a creative space for our next generation where they can be themselves without fear and how the creative spaces might be imagined where we don’t bring in our beliefs with it. Rather make it an open ended space for them to explore. We also discussed a tiny bit about intrinsic motivation and extrinsic motivation.

The next junto would be a 2nd part of the series, and we plan to dig deeper and explore the below scenarios arising out of the above phenomenon:

Are these communities and the creative spaces related to one another? What might connect them?

How blockchain technology might tap into this phenomenon? Is tokenizing this phenomenon the right way to explore the dynamics?if yes, what might tokenization look like in such scenarios? Can the grass-root economy be nurtured through the above phenomenon?

How a tokenized ecosystem might look like if designed keeping in mind the purpose-aligned  aspects of various communities and thus their shared truth?

Does intrinsic motivation comes into picture there? How that may look like?

We invite you all to imagine and dream and ask questions with us together to re-imagine the world of our dreams.

References : Token Economy, How the web3 reinvents the economy, Shermin Voshmgir

https://www.circularconversations.com/conversations/metamodern-values-for-a-listening-society

“​​Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well, or willingness to invest in enterprises that are obviously headed for early success, but, rather, an ability to work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed. The more unpropitious the situation in which we demonstrate hope, the deeper that hope is. Hope is definitely not the same thing as optimism. It is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out. In short, I think that the deepest and most important form of hope, the only one that can keep us above water and urge us to good works, and the only true source of the breathtaking dimension of the human spirit and its efforts, is something we get, as it were, from “elsewhere.” It is also this hope, above all, which gives us the strength to live and continually to try new things, even in conditions that seem as hopeless as ours do, here and now.”

 Note : We made it a series, and will keep designing the space as per the evolving conversations. To keep the space intentional we kept it to 15 people, but if you think you might be interested in joining us we will be very happy to have you with us. Drop a line to either of us via slack/email.

Joel Alexander (Kb5 fellow) and Tanaya (KB4 fellow and KB5 Guide)

Event.title: Crypto Salon - Influencer DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
The Crypto Salon will resume this Wednesday, February 9th at 10:30am GMT

This week we'll discuss influencer DAOs, particularly IreneDAO, in the context of gender, the role of women in crypto more generally, social capital, and the attention economy. As always, this framing will just get us started—Salon attendees are encouraged to introduce other themes into the conversation as they see fit! 

Since we're meeting on short notice, there aren't any recommended readings, but consider checking out some influencer DAOs before the Salon. 

_________

The Crypto Salon is a meetup that explores the social and cultural dimensions of crypto. All are welcome—no academic background necessary!

The Salon is hosted by Annaliese Milano, a KB2 fellow and anthropology PhD student at the London School of Economics who conducted her doctoral research on crypto in part with the Kernel community.

Event.title: Movement with Antonio - BODY GALLERY
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for a twice weekly movement practice with our very own, Antonio Maia. Antonio is a professional dancer and movement aficionado, amongst other skills.

Here's a note from Antonio:

I will be hosting bi weekly movement and dance classes for you all! The activities will range from yoga, sweat workouts, dance improvisations, and posture techniques, and the main goal from this guild will be to aid you through your process here in kernel - it is as important to take care and listen to your body, as it is your mind.

This is aimed also at a greater research project on the benefits of physical practices on learning and working spaces.

I can't wait to get to start training with you and I want to make it clear that regardless of your experience or lack of, every single BODY is welcome and cherished within the class.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

See below for classes and we welcome your participation at any of the sessions which are nourishing to you.

  • 15/2  Vinyasa Flow Beginners 60m

  • 17/2/22: Movement Composition - Somatic Practice  60m

  • 22/2/22: HIIT Workout - Full Body Flow 30m

  • 24/2 Movement Rehab - An intro to healing, sensing , feeling  60m

  • 1/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginners. 60m

  • 3/3 Movement Composition - Trance Dance    60m

  • 8/3 HIIT Workout - Strengthening and toning    40m

  • 10/3 Movement Rehab : Mindful Posture    60m

  • 15/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginner   60m

  • 17/3 Movement Composition - Shaking Body   60m

  • 22/3 HIIT Workout - Aerobic.     40m

  • 24/3 Movement Rehab - Active Resting     60m

  • 29/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginners.    60m

  • 31/3 Shared Responsibility Practice.   60m

Event.title: Gaming Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel. Conceptual analysis is left for your own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision and create a better web together.

imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision
and create a better web together.

Event.title: Web3 Communities w/ IDEO
Event.descriptionHtml:
The Web 3 Communities Guild (with IDEO) will help teams explore tokenized community principles and structures which enable communities to build, maintain and own projects over the long term.

Your facilitators Reuben Bramanathan, Joe Gerber, and Paris Rouzati will host a series of product focused workshops for crypto (or crypto-curious) founders who want to build community owned infrastructure.

Event.title: From hopeless human to greenpilled regen
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Activape during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

Activape is an onboarding tool to transform hopeless humans into greenpilled regens acting together for public goods.

Humanity is facing the greatest crisis of its short existence, and yet most humans are either hopeless, traumatized, or in denial, while those that would like to do something often feel impotent and alone within a system that’s built to resist change.

Web3 has the potential to become a schelling point for the hopeful, but the barriers to entry are still too high. Many get lost in the complexity and end up abandoning the adventure.

Today’s ImpactDAOs and NGOs face common challenges

  • Attract engaged and diverse contributors

  • Improve the time to first meaningful contribution and first payment

  • Empower contributors to act autonomously

Today’s citizens have common needs

  • Find your causes and your people

  • Get rewarded for your positive impact

  • Start acting today for what you care about

Useful documents

  • Brainstorming

  • Pitchdeck

Preliminary program

  1. Why? OKRs? KPIs?

  2. TBD

  3. TBD

  4. Tokenomics? Activist Ikigai NFTs? $ACTIV token? Wen???

  5. TBD

  6. TBD

  7. Preparing for EthCC

  8. TBD

  9. TBD

Event.title: DeFi Demo
Event.descriptionHtml: Explore DeFi products being built during KB4 and some of Tom’s favorite projects being built in the DeFi ecosystem. Demo’s will focus on DeFi, first, but we will also welcome other demos and other product jam related convos if time permits. Tom Schmidt joins us from Dragonfly Capital with deep experience in DeFi, but also from Instagram where he had deep product experience. Both skillsets will be well leveraged in creating space in this guild.

Event.title: Regeneration Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: Hosted by Holly, John and John, this guild is made up by a series of workshops on life, growth and thriving and is intended to help us all deepen our shared understanding of the regenerative movement, with a particular focus on its principles, values and ethics. We’ll be looking at everything from resilient resources to sacred economics as we explore tools, practices, and patterns which will help us live in balance, harmony and health.

Event.title: DeSci Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: In order to better explore this burgeoning space of web3, Sarah Hamburg has graciously agreed to lead a group who will look together at different approaches to decentralising various aspects of the scientific process, from research to publication and beyond. Science does not dispel magic, it reveals it and we are here together to ensure that continues to happen in a free, fair and accessible manner.

Event.title: Zodiac & DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
Explore open tools and new kinds of multichain collaboration within and between DAOs. This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

This build guild is intended as a deep dive into a future where we co-develop open tools for more valuable collaboration. In order to do that, we'll start by going all the way back to the beginning of cooperatives and beyond. Everyone is welcome to join this first conversational session, which will introduce the above and explore the possibilities for culture in The Guilded Age.

In Sessions II, III and IV, we'll be taking a selected group of people through Zodiac: what it is, how to use it, and how to build new stuff for everyone with it. The only criteria for joining this session is that you must be willing to teach others in your block what you learn by hosting your own session at some stage. This is how p2p learning propagates.

Read more here
Event.descriptionText: Explore open tools and new kinds of multichain collaboration within and between DAOs. This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

Event.title: What's the worst that could happen - Launching a community-based token
Event.descriptionHtml: Everyone wants to moon, no one wants to blow up on the pad. What's the worst that could happen? From newbies getting hacked and scammed, to your community objecting to your project, to someone front running your token sale, let's brainstorm all the ways this could go sideways and how to mitigate them. Points for epic stories or how you saved the day.

Event.title: Module 4: Information Age Institutions
Event.descriptionHtml: In Module 4, we explore Information Age Institutions: https://kernel.community/en/learn/module-4 When we use the term 'institution', think of the institution of marriage — a practice or a custom — more than a government institution like the Federal Reserve. "The internet requires that we update the practices and customs we use to relate to one another and organize ourselves. In particular, it has caused critical shifts in three spheres of human life: how we identify ourselves, how we reach consensus, and how we experience time." We are excited to explore with you all tomorrow in rooms small and large.
Event.descriptionText:
In Module 4, we explore Information Age Institutions: https://kernel.community/en/learn/module-4 

When we use the term 'institution', think of the institution of marriage — a practice or a custom — more than a government institution like the Federal Reserve.

"The internet requires that we update the practices and customs we use to relate to one another and organize ourselves.

In particular, it has caused critical shifts in three spheres of human life: how we identify ourselves, how we reach consensus, and how we experience time."

We are excited to explore with you all tomorrow in rooms small and large.

Event.title: DeFi Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: Sugam, Danny, Greg and Julian - all of them past Kernel Fellows - team up to lead you up all the DeFi rabbit holes you could ever dream of. Each of them have expertise of their own and experience about as deep as one can find in such a new industry, which they plan to use to create a collaborative environment focused on practical lessons. This is not a guild which will offer you trading advice and strategies: it is an intentional look at the kinds of tools, patterns and openings which might actually make truly public financial infrastructure, and make it good.

Event.title: How might we govern decentralized AI R&D
Event.descriptionHtml: Here we'll discuss how we might coordinate and govern AI algorithm development in our decentralized working group. This is happening on Thursday and we are currently leaning towards developing a generative art model for NFTs. Some initial ideas for discussion: 1. Create a DAO on DAOhaus for the working group with contributors as members 2. Algovera could put $1000 in a shared treasury to be spend as the DAO sees fit (based on voting) 3. Algorithm tokens that we mint and distribute will be controlled by the DAO
Event.descriptionText:
Here we'll discuss how we might coordinate and govern AI algorithm development in our decentralized working group. This is happening on Thursday and we are currently leaning towards developing a generative art model for NFTs.

Some initial ideas for discussion:
1. Create a DAO on DAOhaus for the working group with contributors as members
2. Algovera could put $1000 in a shared treasury to be spend as the DAO sees fit (based on voting)
3. Algorithm tokens that we mint and distribute will be controlled by the DAO

Event.title: Elevating Web3 UX
Event.descriptionHtml: In this Junto we will continue a discussion that was started by @Monique 2 weeks ago on “Designing for web 3”. This Junto will ask how we can make the Web3 experience simple enough for the non-crypto inclined, but also powerful enough to support the most seasoned of Ethereum veterans. Our conversation may start with onboarding, familiarising new “Ethereans” with wallets, their benefits as well as risks and how to ensure that tradeoffs made for usability do not compromise security. Another topic may then be especially the challenge of social applications build on Ethereum, where monetary incentives are at first not as predominant as in many other web 3 related applications, but could become a future challenge. Finally we may ask what types of “dark patterns” present in web 2 UX could be avoided as we rebuild the web. With Hester Bruikman product, UX, Design @ethstatus and the UX/design from akasha.org currently building akasha.ethereum.world we will have several interesting guests in this Junto joining us in KB4. Feel free to DM me or bring along your most pressing questions! Looking forward! Yours, Martin
Event.descriptionText:
In this Junto we will continue a discussion that was started by @Monique 2 weeks ago on “Designing for web 3”.
This Junto will ask how we can make the Web3 experience simple enough for the non-crypto inclined, but also powerful enough to support the most seasoned of Ethereum veterans.

Our conversation may start with onboarding, familiarising new “Ethereans” with wallets, their benefits as well as risks and how to ensure that tradeoffs made for usability do not compromise security. 
Another topic may then be especially the challenge of social applications build on Ethereum, where monetary incentives are at first not as predominant as in many other web 3 related applications, but could become a future challenge. Finally we may ask what types of “dark patterns” present in web 2 UX could be avoided as we rebuild the web. 

With Hester Bruikman product, UX, Design @ethstatus and the UX/design from akasha.org currently building akasha.ethereum.world we will have several interesting guests in this Junto joining us in KB4. 

Feel free to DM me or bring along your most pressing questions! 

Looking forward!

Yours, 
Martin

Event.title: Kernel course material podcast planning
Event.descriptionHtml: I absolutely love the Kernel content but my ideal learning medium isn't reading. I skip and skim and am too adhd to fully absorb. How about a series of podcasts that are audio versions of the modules (plus maybe extracts from the reference material?) I know I'd be more absorbing of the content this way and I'm confident that would apply to others too. It might be a nice way of getting the Kernel word out further too. If the idea lands well then I'd be happy to do whatever I could to help. Maybe I could interview y’all and get the ball rolling?

Event.title: Movement with Antonio - BODY GALLERY
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for a twice weekly movement practice with our very own, Antonio Maia. Antonio is a professional dancer and movement aficionado, amongst other skills.

Here's a note from Antonio:

I will be hosting bi weekly movement and dance classes for you all! The activities will range from yoga, sweat workouts, dance improvisations, and posture techniques, and the main goal from this guild will be to aid you through your process here in kernel - it is as important to take care and listen to your body, as it is your mind.

This is aimed also at a greater research project on the benefits of physical practices on learning and working spaces.

I can't wait to get to start training with you and I want to make it clear that regardless of your experience or lack of, every single BODY is welcome and cherished within the class.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

See below for classes and we welcome your participation at any of the sessions which are nourishing to you.

  • 15/2  Vinyasa Flow Beginners 60m

  • 17/2/22: Movement Composition - Somatic Practice  60m

  • 22/2/22: HIIT Workout - Full Body Flow 30m

  • 24/2 Movement Rehab - An intro to healing, sensing , feeling  60m

  • 1/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginners. 60m

  • 3/3 Movement Composition - Trance Dance    60m

  • 8/3 HIIT Workout - Strengthening and toning    40m

  • 10/3 Movement Rehab : Mindful Posture    60m

  • 15/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginner   60m

  • 17/3 Movement Composition - Shaking Body   60m

  • 22/3 HIIT Workout - Aerobic.     40m

  • 24/3 Movement Rehab - Active Resting     60m

  • 29/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginners.    60m

  • 31/3 Shared Responsibility Practice.   60m

Event.title: Token Communities
Event.descriptionHtml: Collaborate with your peers to map and visualise token economies you’re interested in learning more about. Hosted by Reuben from IDEO and Michael from KB4 and HERE, this guild votes on tokens or economies we’d all like to understand better and then spends their sessions co-creating Figma boards which, through better questions, literally map the flows of value in each system. Occasionally special guests will join in the fun, but the focus is always on shared sense-making.

Event.title: Movement with Antonio - BODY GALLERY
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for a twice weekly movement practice with our very own, Antonio Maia. Antonio is a professional dancer and movement aficionado, amongst other skills.

Here's a note from Antonio:

I will be hosting bi weekly movement and dance classes for you all! The activities will range from yoga, sweat workouts, dance improvisations, and posture techniques, and the main goal from this guild will be to aid you through your process here in kernel - it is as important to take care and listen to your body, as it is your mind.

This is aimed also at a greater research project on the benefits of physical practices on learning and working spaces.

I can't wait to get to start training with you and I want to make it clear that regardless of your experience or lack of, every single BODY is welcome and cherished within the class.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

See below for classes and we welcome your participation at any of the sessions which are nourishing to you.

  • 15/2  Vinyasa Flow Beginners 60m

  • 17/2/22: Movement Composition - Somatic Practice  60m

  • 22/2/22: HIIT Workout - Full Body Flow 30m

  • 24/2 Movement Rehab - An intro to healing, sensing , feeling  60m

  • 1/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginners. 60m

  • 3/3 Movement Composition - Trance Dance    60m

  • 8/3 HIIT Workout - Strengthening and toning    40m

  • 10/3 Movement Rehab : Mindful Posture    60m

  • 15/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginner   60m

  • 17/3 Movement Composition - Shaking Body   60m

  • 22/3 HIIT Workout - Aerobic.     40m

  • 24/3 Movement Rehab - Active Resting     60m

  • 29/3 Vinyasa Flow Beginners.    60m

  • 31/3 Shared Responsibility Practice.   60m

Event.title: Implications of Credentialing in Web3
Event.descriptionHtml: The popular narrative around education in web3 is the idea that if learning events can be recorded on-chain, then they'll solve a lot of problems. But what about the problems they create/perpetuate? Learning events become immutable performative speech acts when recorded on chain. This opens up a whole host of issues that need to be carefully considered. Bring your wildest ideas for incentivizing play & exploration, removing status games from education, and allowing true learning to take place.
Event.descriptionText: The popular narrative around education in web3 is the idea that if learning events can be recorded on-chain, then they'll solve a lot of problems. But what about the problems they create/perpetuate? Learning events become immutable performative speech acts when recorded on chain. This opens up a whole host of issues that need to be carefully considered. Bring your wildest ideas for incentivizing play & exploration, removing status games from education, and allowing true learning to take place.

Event.title: Live Streaming for Web3
Event.descriptionHtml: How can web3 create better opportunities for creators? Let's talk about web3, streaming, Twitch/Youtube and how there's a better path forward for creators.

Event.title: Infinity Games
Event.descriptionHtml:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto!

In this one, we'll talk about Infinity Games

You will be in a zoom chat alongside with 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or, Steward.

Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community

If you may serendipitously miss your interview, please do not fret and take a deep breath! You'll be able to reschedule it, we promise.

Event.title: Ethics of AI
Event.descriptionHtml: With AI in Web3, we have another chance to bake in ethical considerations from the get go (rather than leaving it as an afterthought). What values do we want to uphold with the next generation of AI systems? What are the issues with traditional AI ethics? How can we get larger communities (including non-technical) to have a stake in AI?
Event.descriptionText: With AI in Web3, we have another chance to bake in ethical considerations from the get go (rather than leaving it as an afterthought). What values do we want to uphold with the next generation of AI systems? What are the issues with traditional AI ethics?  How can we get larger communities (including non-technical) to have a stake in AI?

Event.title: Regeneration Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: Hosted by Holly, John and John, this guild is made up by a series of workshops on life, growth and thriving and is intended to help us all deepen our shared understanding of the regenerative movement, with a particular focus on its principles, values and ethics. We’ll be looking at everything from resilient resources to sacred economics as we explore tools, practices, and patterns which will help us live in balance, harmony and health.

This is aimed also at a greater research project on the benefits of physical practices on learning and working spaces.

I can't wait to get to start training with you and I want to make it clear that regardless of your experience or lack of, every single BODY is welcome and cherished within the class.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

Event.title: KB5 First Week
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hello Guides,

We will be conducting 16 rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from Dec 2 - Dec 14Interview Days 1-8: Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in room with 3-4 potential KB5 fellows in each round of conversation of 1 hour.

  • Day 1: Thursday (Dec 2): Play of Pattern, Trust
  • Day 2: Friday (Dec 3): Meaning, Value
  • Day 3: Monday (Dec 6): Asking Better Questions, Money & Speech
  • Day 4: Tuesday (Dec 7): Intention, Freedom
  • Day 5: Wednesday (Dec 8): Govern Yourself, Liberally Radical
  • Day 6: Thursday (Dec 9): Incentives, Listening
  • Day 7: Monday (Dec 13): Censorship Resistance, Learn
  • Day 8: Tuesday (Dec 14): Giving, Scalability
You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

Event.descriptionHtml: In our previous juntos, we've discussed the benefits of decentralized AI and AI ethics. This time we'll explore the potential applications of AI to climate.

Event.title: DeSci Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: In order to better explore this burgeoning space of web3, Sarah Hamburg has graciously agreed to lead a group who will look together at different approaches to decentralising various aspects of the scientific process, from research to publication and beyond. Science does not dispel magic, it reveals it and we are here together to ensure that continues to happen in a free, fair and accessible manner.

Event.title: Crypto Art and Culture
Event.descriptionHtml: Led by Yulia and Ben, the Crypto Arts & Culture Guild is an interactive curriculum for non-technical builders, with each week being a deep dive into the different cultural edges of web3: art, marketing, design, community management, and more, recognizing the people behind the protocols and the cultural frameworks they operate within. This guild is an invitation to review cultural past, communal present and discuss our potential futures.

Event.title: Kernel Principles Glass Bead Game
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for dialogic games structured around the Kernel principles. We'll likely try to play two rounds, using the first two principles: Play with Pattern and Trust is not only transactional.

What is a Glass Bead Game?

Well, it comes from Herman Hesse's novel of the same name. Here are some quotes which should hopefully leave you asking better questions:

"The Glass Bead Game is an act of mental synthesis through which the spiritual values of all ages are perceived as simultaneously present and vitally alive."

"The Glass Bead Game is thus a mode of playing with the total contents and values of our culture; it plays with them as, say, in the great age of the arts a painter might have played with the colors on his palette."

"There is truth. But the doctrine you desire, absolute, perfect dogma that alone provides wisdom, does not exist. Nor should you long for a perfect doctrine, my friend. Rather, you should long for the perfection of yourself. The deity is with you, not in ideas and books. Truth is lived, not taught."

And one last one from our dear friend, Magister Ludi LCC, to straighten it all out:

"On the in breath, one contemplates the nature of the playground: the self as totality of being.

On the out breath, one meditates on the nature of the player: the self as pure consciousness."

Event.title: Gaming Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel. Conceptual analysis is left for your own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision and create a better web together.

Event.title: Be-to-Earn Models | Junto
Event.descriptionHtml:
The purpose of this junto is to continue the conversation around some concepts inspired from the Douglas Rushkoff's fireside: in a world where market reigns all, anything that is not consumption is antithetical to existence. How do we slow down, extend, and incentivize the idea of “just being”?

We will explore the collective building of the future (and at what pace?), our own internal programming of our "societal value" and self-worth based on productivity, and the way we want web3 to reward slowness and intentionality. The last is an important question, as we are in process of creating the map of the values, embedded in tech and on the blockchain, we'd like to preserve for the years to come.

Sampling of some topics I'm curious in exploring further

  • Proof of Being: what defines being?

  • Structuring a being-panopticon, and is this something we want?

  • The concept of leaving room for "free-loaders" (ie in a UBI economy), and being okay with that -- the collectivist mindset is currently so uncomfortable with this concept because we are taught so much to judge this trait in ourselves and others

  • Appreciation of negative space, and how it comes up on our individual lives

  • How do we still the global economy while also maintaining our priority to art, play, and the richness of experiences that move us?

We are human being not human doings.

Be here now, and find expansiveness in the stillness.

We will explore the collective building of the future (and at what pace?), our own internal programming of our "societal value" and self-worth based on productivity, and the way we want web3 to reward slowness and intentionality. The last is an important question, as we are in process of creating the map of the values, embedded in tech and on the blockchain, we'd like to preserve for the years to come.

Sampling of some topics I'm curious in exploring further

Proof of Being: what defines being?

Structuring a being-panopticon, and is this something we want?

The concept of leaving room for "free-loaders" (ie in a UBI economy), and being okay with that -- the collectivist mindset is currently so uncomfortable with this concept because we are taught so much to judge this trait in ourselves and others

Appreciation of negative space, and how it comes up on our individual lives

How do we still the global economy while also maintaining our priority to art, play, and the richness of experiences that move us?

We are human being not human doings. 

Be here now, and find expansiveness in the stillness.

Event.title: Crypto and the Political Climate In Latin America Pt II - Recorded
Event.descriptionHtml:
Separated families at the Mexican border, the diminishing Bolivar currency in Venezuela, environmentalists rights violations in Honduras…

Let’s hear from our Latin American community beyond news headlines.

How can cryptographic technology help displaced families? How can land ownership expand beyond geopolitical borders? How will shifts in home ownership dynamics impact home design? How can the process for remittances be approved? How might more people grow their own food and trade with each other?

This conversation will record the conversation.

Event.descriptionHtml:
We invite you to explore this conversational space with us. A slack conversation between Tanaya and Joel sparked the question and we thought of creating a junto where we can explore the topic with a few more of you. We would like to make this topic a weekly junto and let the topic consciously evolve.

As you may imagine this topic is closely related with values, community and trust. As we explore this evolving space together we are sharing a few links which we think might make us think and guide,

Here is a wonderful writing on magic internet money, and its relation to values and community

https://medium.com/@cryptowanderer/merry-merkle-magic-1458a25ee2dd

A closely related reading topic:

https://www.circularconversations.com/conversations/metamodern-values-for-a-listening-society

We will keep adding reading links each week based on the direction the conversation takes.

Looking forward to learning with you all together. 

Joel (KB5 Fellow) and Tanaya (KB5 Guide, KB4 Fellow)

Event.title: KB5 WanderWeek
Event.descriptionHtml:
WanderWeek (15th Feb - 22nd Feb)​

WanderWeek is the kickoff of the KERNEL Build Track and the newest version of the Commit-Reveal Hackathon. It is inclusive and encourages all skill sets in KERNEL to co-create and build upon their Adventures together. It’s where your Adventures meet, meld, morph, and mend. As you encounter like-minded Fellows in KERNEL, you’ll connect with some on a similar wavelength 🌊. WanderWeek is the realm in which you will ideate and build upon each others’ ideas, as teams or individuals.

​Timeline

  1. ​WanderWeek Kickoff & Mindful Prototyping (w/ Andrej) (Feb 15 - 11:00 AM EST)

  2. ​Idea Validation w/ Mentors & Guides (Feb 18 - 11:00 AM EST)

  3. Optional Weekend Checkpoints (w/ Stewards & Guides)

  4. ​WanderWeek Celebrations & Showcase (Feb 22 - 10:00 AM EST)

​WanderWeek is curated for KB5 Fellows who are interested in co-creating their KERNEL adventures and ideas from all walks of life (gaming, DeFi, DAO’s, regeneration, writing, researching, extensions of our pluriverse - it’s all fair game).

Event.title: Democratizing real-estate investing - OpenSea for fractional realestate
Event.descriptionHtml:
Belief: Ownership of financial assets, especially realestate is the clearest path to financial freedom - something we believe should be accessible by all, not just the privileged. Through fractionalization we can breakdown barriers to asset ownership and financial freedom for all, and at the same time, reinvent the realestate investment industry

Mission: At Zaha we are using web2 and web3 technology to build an efficient and compliant global marketplace for for fractional realestate asset investing to enable 2 initial products:

Product 1 - Zaha Villas: Fractionalization and co-ownership of 2nd homes: a proven and scaleable business model (like pacaso.com -> Unicorn in 5m). This will enable us to master equity fractionalization / sell down and create an at scale portfolio to pilot our proprietary secondary marketplace solution:

On-block secondary marketplace solution (Zaha Marketplace) to enable:

1. Highly liquid secondary market

2. Highly efficient transfer of cash yield to fractional owners

Product 2 - Zaha Hotels & Residences: We will fractionalize larger more complex yield generating property assets such as hotels and multi-family residential assets. To do this we need to have already successfully piloted the on-block secondary marketplace solution

Project Progress: Secured seed round financing within 2 weeks of project start

Event.title: AMA - NFT Virtual Real Estate
Event.descriptionHtml:
Virtual property and digital collectibles are the future of crypto exchanges. NFTs are the underlying technology bringing virtual real estate to the metaverse. Superworld is a virtual world mapped onto real world properties available to collect as NFTs. 

Join Devon Vert from the Superworld Inner Circle in an Ask Me Anything style discussion on:

  • NFT Real Estate Trading

  • NFT Real Estate Security

  • NFT Real Estate Mobile Gamification

NFT Real Estate is expanding the creativity of artists, architects and designers. Including your moderators Rumi and Tagan. In support of the duos curation for the NFT.NYC Kernel Art Dinner, Superworld gifted the Opera Sneaker artist collective a virtual land plot. 

This event will be held on LinkedIn Live. To attend the event you will need a LinkedIn account.

Event.title: DAOs and Dragons
Event.descriptionHtml: Adventure across unknown, multichain, time-shifted collaborative landscapes with Kei and Isaac. We’ll introduce you to DAOs, give you some of their prehistory, find out what kind of work you may be doing in this brave new world, and then deploy our own DAO. We’ll use the remaining sessions to provide prompts in the style of Dungeons & Dragons to take us all through various scenarios with the goal of documenting different pattern languages for DAOs made up of different numbers of people, motivated by different goals, and attacked by different kinds of adversaries.

Event.descriptionHtml:
WanderWeek (15th Feb - 22nd Feb)​

WanderWeek is the kickoff of the KERNEL Build Track and the newest version of the Commit-Reveal Hackathon. It is inclusive and encourages all skill sets in KERNEL to co-create and build upon their Adventures together. It’s where your Adventures meet, meld, morph, and mend. As you encounter like-minded Fellows in KERNEL, you’ll connect with some on a similar wavelength 🌊. WanderWeek is the realm in which you will ideate and build upon each others’ ideas, as teams or individuals.

​Timeline

  1. ​WanderWeek Kickoff & Mindful Prototyping (w/ Andrej) (Feb 15 - 11:00 AM EST)

  2. ​Idea Validation w/ Mentors & Guides (Feb 18 - 11:00 AM EST)

  3. Optional Weekend Checkpoints (w/ Stewards & Guides)

  4. ​WanderWeek Celebrations & Showcase (Feb 22 - 10:00 AM EST)

​WanderWeek is curated for KB5 Fellows who are interested in co-creating their KERNEL adventures and ideas from all walks of life (gaming, DeFi, DAO’s, regeneration, writing, researching, extensions of our pluriverse - it’s all fair game).

Event.title: Cost of Cyberattacks for Blockchains
Event.descriptionHtml:
Cyberattacks aimed at disrupting the provision of technological services are on the rise. As one of the most popular types of assaults, DDoSs may cause the most interruption to internet services and, as a result, blockchain-based solutions. As a result, websites are interrupted and mobile applications become unavailable, potentially causing organisations to incur ever-increasing losses and costs. DDoS attacks on blockchains are different from typical attacks because blockchains are distributed platforms.

Here is some important questions I would love to discuss and chatting about :

How to secure our digital and physical assets in Web3?

What is real meaning of Blockchain Security?

How Quantum Computers will power up Blockchains?

Have you experience any cyberattack causes mental and financial losses?

Event.title: Imagining a Web3 integrated music industry
Event.location: https://meet.google.com/mre-hdrd-ycf Otherwise, to join by phone, dial +1 347-396-1726 and enter this PIN: 584 946 016# To view more phone numbers, click this link: https://tel.meet/mre-hdrd-ycf?hs=5
Event.descriptionHtml: Please join The Mint List and BPM DAO founder Hanifah Walidah and other strong voices around music in Kernel to have an open brainstorming session around what the music industry could look and operate like with an integrated mix of Web3 solutions and a return to music culture. What cues can we take from history when using new technology? The Abundance protocol vs Scarcity? How can artists and fans relate differently to one another and create an impact in the world as a musical movement of people? Below are the following who have committed as more names may be added. All are welcome to come listen, ask questions and add to the conversation. *The Mint List is a weekly curated mix of music NFTs on Spotify and Apple podcasts. The BPM DAO which is being formulated here in Kernel looks to focus on a market culture of integrated products and solutions to facilitate Web3 music standards and options for community-driven discovery and distribution.

How can artists and fans relate differently to one another and create an impact in the world as a musical movement of people? Below are the following who have committed as more names may be added. All are welcome to come listen, ask questions and add to the conversation.  *The Mint List is a weekly curated mix of music NFTs on Spotify and Apple podcasts.  The BPM DAO which is being formulated here in Kernel looks to focus on a market culture of integrated products and solutions to facilitate Web3 music standards and options for community-driven discovery and distribution.

Event.title: Signature economies - reimagining ownership
Event.descriptionHtml:
A conversation driven with Andy on the changing meaning of ownership on the blockchain

"The network is ownerless, yet anyone who creates a key ‘owns’ any coins associated with it, so everyone is an owner. This confusion reveals how ‘ownership’ is shifting and highlights the opportunity we have not to implement an ‘ownership economy’, but to reimagine what being an owner means...

"What do I actually control?"

"ownership in digital economies is really about the meaningful signatures required to execute state changes while maintaining consensus. Is ownership shifting from an ability to demonstrate control or possession to the ability to make meaning?"

Motivating document

Event.title: Onboarding and DAOs. How to start an engaging DAO. Designing for the human experience.
Event.descriptionHtml:
What does a great DAO onboarding process look like?

There are no bad team, only bad leaders --Jocko Willnik

I reference this quote above to demonstrated that leaders and/or founding mission/principals of an organization must train and onboard their members so they can be effective. To achieve participation/engagement what mechanisms have you seen that work? What experiments could be done to test strategies?

On the flip side-what are examples of things that don't work?

In our DAO 2 breakout session during the Wander Week show case and celebration , Dayana, Marlon, and a whole host of other fellows had this same question and concern.

I don't have the answers, but this is my and Luciene's journey this week as we explore a bit of Cuppa with Sal.

Event.descriptionHtml:
Bitcoin in Venezuela, Bitcoin Beach in El Salvador and DAOs for the Amazon…

Let’s hear from our Latin American community beyond news headlines.

How are these crypto projects impacting people living in these areas? How would Latin Americans like to see cryptocurrency solutions implemented? How can the global community support their communities without disrupting their culture?

Event.title: Technoetic Art[Kungfu] x youth x OpenCOP
Event.descriptionHtml: Come kick up some consciousness with Kungfu with Shi Kai, from LongHash Ventures, some Taoist talk, and some COP26 youth activists (who might be in the room). You can enter via zoom link below or (better!) via our crypto base camp (Crypt of Inclusivity: ChiPunk) via sparklever.se https://eventbrite.com/e/opencop-tickets-201591293987 Technoetic Art: https://www.futurelearn.com/info/courses/taoism-and-western-culture/0/steps/105398 ** Fun blurb: Luk Hup Batt Fatt (LHBF) is founded by Chen Hsi Yi and based upon Taoist principles. The entire system is a way of life based on living in harmony with the universe. As such, all its philosophies, concepts, patterns, weapons and meditations are fluid, dynamic and effortless. LHBF is therefore softer, slower and more difficult to understand and train than any comparable internal style like Tai Chi. It is also the oldest and most advanced of internal styles, being the predecessor to styles like Tai Chi, Ba Gua, and Xing Yi Fist. LHBF has for over a thousand years represented the highest wisdom and virtues of Taoist-based Chinese martial arts. Bak Mei is Shaolin–based, derived by the greatest Shaolin Grandmaster of all time – Bak Mei. It is the most dynamic, direct and comprehensive practical combat style of martial arts ever devised. Every technique or movement with weapons or freehand is calculated to overwhelm and destroy the enemy.
Event.descriptionText:
Come kick up some consciousness with Kungfu with Shi Kai, from LongHash Ventures, some Taoist talk, and some COP26 youth activists (who might be in the room). 
You can enter via zoom link below or (better!) via our crypto base camp (Crypt of Inclusivity: ChiPunk) via sparklever.se 
https://eventbrite.com/e/opencop-tickets-201591293987

Technoetic Art: https://www.futurelearn.com/info/courses/taoism-and-western-culture/0/steps/105398

**
Fun blurb:
Luk Hup Batt Fatt (LHBF) is founded by Chen Hsi Yi and based upon Taoist principles. The entire system is a way of life based on living in harmony with the universe. As such, all its philosophies, concepts, patterns, weapons and meditations are fluid, dynamic and effortless.

LHBF is therefore softer, slower and more difficult to understand and train than any comparable internal style like Tai Chi. It is also the oldest and most advanced of internal styles, being the predecessor to styles like Tai Chi, Ba Gua, and Xing Yi Fist.
LHBF has for over a thousand years represented the highest wisdom and virtues of Taoist-based Chinese martial arts.

Bak Mei is Shaolin–based, derived by the greatest Shaolin Grandmaster of all time – Bak Mei. It is the most dynamic, direct and comprehensive practical combat style of martial arts ever devised. Every technique or movement with weapons or freehand is calculated to overwhelm and destroy the enemy.

Event.title: From KYC to know-your-neighbor
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Solidarity during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

We are building a citizen-led global basic income, based on a compounding web of trust and care that is created through the recording of authentic conversations between neighbors.

Context

SolidarityCard is evolving. In the beginning, we talked about a debit card for homeless and undocumented people. However, it was never intended to be exclusively for them, but for everyone.

Since we initially focused our communication around helping this population, many people misunderstood the need to record our conversations and the essential role of these recordings to provide an alternative to KYC. Furthermore, convincing governments to try this alternative and being able to issue debit cards to people without official documents and proof-of-address is going to take some time.

Liberating ourselves from poverty is not simply a financial matter, it is also about liberating our minds from the idea that poverty and inequality are acceptable conditions in our society. We have built all our social structures based on the narrative that humans are valuable for what they produce and that being successful means owning more than the others with which we are in competition. But narratives can be rewritten and societies can be transformed.

Ultimately, our goal is neither a debit card, nor a web of trust, not even a basic income, but social cohesion and long-term thinking at a global scale.

Initiatives

After tons of illuminating exchanges with your brilliant minds we now think that we can start building everything else before the card. If we break apart the different blocks in a well thought out manner, they can start creating value for all our Web3 projects and also for society at large.

These are some of the initiatives we think could be useful for this stage:

  • Activator App

  • Identity Certificate NFT

  • Mystery 1-on-1 conversations

  • SolidarityVoice on Twitter Spaces

Useful links

  • Pitchdeck

  • Initiatives

Preliminary program

19 May - Reframing our mission and brand

26 May - Defining what needs to be built and in what order

2 June - Storytelling

9 June - Tokenomics

16 June - TBD

23 June - How we will measure if we are achieving our goals

30 June - Preparing for EthCC

7 July - TBD

14 July - TBD

Event.title: Junto - Schelling points - Coordination games - Incentive engineering
Event.descriptionHtml:
Let's discuss how Schelling points, coordination games, incentive engineering create economic value in digital media and how we can leverage these mechanisms in an empathic way to create collective value.

Inspiring thought to reflect on:

"The economic goods produced by a materials economy are material goods, while the economic goods produced by digital economy are focal point goods. Focal points are the more and less optimal solutions to coordination problems in the absence of direct communication." Olympus DAO Whitepaper

Pre-readings link

Event.title: Self Love with Vivek Singh
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL is an internet garden cultivating care founded by Vivek Singh. In February, Vivek led a conversation at the ETHDenver event Schelling Point on Communities of Care. 

Let's continue the conversation on a key element to Communities of Care-- Self Love. Join the event on Twitter Spaces hosted Mindfulness NFT club members JOAN, Tagan and Rumi.

Event.title: Privacy and Self-Sovereignty in Emergent Worlds
Event.descriptionHtml:
The Task Ahead

Build and disseminate a new framework for privacy-enhancing technologies and data security standards commensurate to the task of managing and protecting privacy in blockchain-based technologies, the metaverse, and emergent environments.

To aid you in determining whether you have the right level of interest, bandwidth, and giveafark for this adventure, I elaborate three possible versions of what we might accomplish, below:

  • The best possible world: The framework we develop is sufficiently robust, well-researched, and technically feasible. It is immediately actionable by a broad spectrum of protocols, games, and token developers who gave us input AND several of them have signed on to implement our framework.

  • An even better world: The framework we develop is sufficiently robust, well-researched, and technically feasible. It is immediately actionable by a broad spectrum of protocols, games, and token developers who gave us input.

  • A pretty darn good world: The framework we develop is sufficiently detailed, well-researched, and technically feasible, but only in theory. We have not battle-tested it with enough protocols, games, and token developers to feel confident just yet.

❗Caveat (You Are Welcome And Needed Here!)

This is not a project that is only for engineers and cryptographers. I’m neither. Privacy is a citizen issue. It’s a legal and compliance challenge, an ethics challenge, an education and coalition-building challenge just as much as it is an engineering challenge. So please, if you care about building human-first tech and don’t want a Cambridge Analytica redux, we need writers, interviewers, organizers, coordinators, educators, and planners as well as engineers, cryptographers, and privacy researchers.

Event.title: Block 5 Potentials
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hello Guides,

We will be conducting 16 rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from Dec 2 - Dec 14.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB5 fellows for each round.

  • Day 1: Thursday (Dec 2): Play of Pattern, Trust
  • Day 2: Friday (Dec 3): Meaning, Value
  • Day 3: Monday (Dec 6): Asking Better Questions, Money & Speech
  • Day 4: Tuesday (Dec 7): Intention, Freedom
  • Day 5: Wednesday (Dec 8): Govern Yourself, Liberally Radical
  • Day 6: Thursday (Dec 9): Incentives, Listening
  • Day 7: Monday (Dec 13): Censorship Resistance, Learn
  • Day 8: Tuesday (Dec 14): Giving, Scalability

You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

Event.title: Reimagining authentication for humans and machines
Event.descriptionHtml: Silent Auth's vision is to become the de facto authentication mechanism for web3. The details are in our Gitcoin grant: https://gitcoin.co/grants/4151/silentauth-the-de-facto-multi-factor-authenticator This session will be a collective exploration of different authentication practices and how we can reimagine their security, usability, and accessibility as we build our new [cross+off+on]chain worlds.

Event.title: 🚶‍♀️The Walkie-Talkie Series🚶
Event.descriptionHtml:
Where kindred Kernel spirits walk the walk while they talk the talk!

Welcome to the reverse metaverse! Juntos go mobile in this series of discussions that may be centered around any topic (and the participating fellows), but to get movement in, sedentary hegemony be damned :)

The only prerequisite for this is that you are away from screens and are on the move in a safe environment :)

Tentative topic : web3 goes physical

Recommended setup: phone with internet, zoom/google meet, earphones, space to walk around (outdoors/indoors). Video will be off for the most part. Discussions in #jam-walkie-talkie

credits to Sylvia for 'reverse metaverse' and for Vivek to playtest this with me as our preferred conversation format. You are encouraged to host these juntos at different times too!

Event.title: How play2earn scholarships work - the path to the next 1 billion web3 users
Event.descriptionHtml:
stats:

20% of Metamask Users are from the Philippines

forecast NFT penetration in the Philippines is 40%

first 2 a16z investments in PH-based companies are in play2earn

Why are all these happening? Simple: Scholarships. "Scholarships are revenue-sharing programs that allow new players to borrow or rent NFTs, so they can play the game without having to spend any money. Any resulting in-game rewards are shared between the player and the owner of the NFT"--YGG

Let's talk about

-how it works, how is it sustainable

-why it matters

-how it happens elsewhere

-its long-term trajectory

Event.title: Block 5 Potentials
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hello Guides,

We will be conducting 16 rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from Dec 2 - Dec 14.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB5 fellows for each round.

  • Day 1: Thursday (Dec 2): Play of Pattern, Trust
  • Day 2: Friday (Dec 3): Meaning, Value
  • Day 3: Monday (Dec 6): Asking Better Questions, Money & Speech
  • Day 4: Tuesday (Dec 7): Intention, Freedom
  • Day 5: Wednesday (Dec 8): Govern Yourself, Liberally Radical
  • Day 6: Thursday (Dec 9): Incentives, Listening
  • Day 7: Monday (Dec 13): Censorship Resistance, Learn
  • Day 8: Tuesday (Dec 14): Giving, Scalability

You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

Event.title: Better property rental marketplace using web3 tools
Event.descriptionHtml:
Real estate rental is a 127 Trillion dollar industry globally which accounts for 60% of all mainstream assets. For US alone, The rental property market is less than half of the $36+ Trillion US Real estate market, yet for small property investors, it’s a fertile paradise. As a renter (traveler) as well as real estate investor and Airbnb host myself, I see some struggles for being a renter and being a host in this centuries long industry. I think we can do better with some of the web3 tools on hand! Here are some topics I'd like to discuss:

  • What are problems with existing rental platforms like Airbnb, VRBO, Facebook Marketplace, Craiglist (yes the classics :D)?

  • What features web3 can bring in?

  • What would take to make a successful vampire attack to Airbnb?

(figma board link follows. if i can't edit this event anymore, it will be shared at the event.)

Event.title: web3dev - a web3 software developers community
Event.descriptionHtml:
Web3dev is the largest and most engaged web3 developers community in Latin America.

There are thousand of great developers in LATAM ready to join the web3 movement, but most learning content is only available in English. This is a limitation for them. We are building a developers community for web3 technologies in Latin America. We engage people to translate English content and also produce original content for specific blockchains.

We already have a Discord with more than 400 developers: https://bit.ly/w3b3d3v/ Our community is organized in pods, each pod for a different theme or blockchain. Each pod has a leader, which helps that pod to evolve, promoting growth to the ecosystem and the whole web3dev community.

We already have leaders for Ethereum, Cardano, NEAR, Algorand and Solana. We incentivize those pods, creating bounties and paying individual contributors when they create new content and deliver value. Our objective is to Bring thousands of web2 developers to the web3 world.

Brazil is the biggest economy in Latin America and have thousand of high talent developers. When more Brazilian (and other Portuguese speakers) developers have the tools to build innovative solutions, web3 tech can be used to solve different problems in Brazil such as agro-business green certification, forest devastation environmental issues, better wealth distribution and hunger.

Our developer's experience does not stop on the learning. We help developers to find real projects to exercise and improve their web3 skill. We put them to work on web3 projects and mentor them while building. All profit we get from these projects are re-invested into the community, generating more engagement and opening opportunities for more people to join the movement.

For the developers, web3dev is a place for them to meet, exchange, learn and find jobs

For companies, it is a place to find curated talent, managed teams and solutions to their business challenges.

Event.title: DeFi and TradFi
Event.descriptionHtml:
"With the things we must learn before doing, we learn by doing" -Aristotle, The Nicomachean Ethics

As decentralized finance grows to autonomously manage hundreds of billions of dollars of assets, one natural question is where can the technology make the greatest difference. Some look towards existing financial institutions, either as adopters internally of the technology, as investors in existing on chain asset classes such as ETH, or as contributors to the ecosystem by bringing new asset classes on chain.

Join us as we discuss the intersection between DeFi, banking, institutional investors, and how to align the interests of all parties involved in order to empower the Web3 community and the future of blockchain technology.

Event.title: Communities Creative spaces and the initiation of open-ended token design around it.
Event.location: To join the video meeting, click this link: https://meet.google.com/wyx-yrpe-pfg Otherwise, to join by phone, dial +1 413-418-2192 and enter this PIN: 403 763 761# To view more phone numbers, click this link: https://tel.meet/wyx-yrpe-pfg?hs=5
Event.descriptionHtml:
In our last junto we discussed communities and various aspects related to communities, nurturing a creative space for our next generation where they can be themselves without fear and how the creative spaces might be imagined where we don’t bring in our beliefs with it. Rather make it an open ended space for them to explore. We also discussed a tiny bit about intrinsic motivation and extrinsic motivation.

The next junto would be a 2nd part of the series, and we plan to dig deeper and explore the below scenarios arising out of the above phenomenon:

Are these communities and the creative spaces related to one another? What might connect them?

How blockchain technology might tap into this phenomenon? Is tokenizing this phenomenon the right way to explore the dynamics?if yes, what might tokenization look like in such scenarios? Can the grass-root economy be nurtured through the above phenomenon?

How a tokenized ecosystem might look like if designed keeping in mind the purpose-aligned  aspects of various communities and thus their shared truth?

Does intrinsic motivation comes into picture there? How that may look like?

We invite you all to imagine and dream and ask questions with us together to re-imagine the world of our dreams.

References : Token Economy, How the web3 reinvents the economy, Shermin Voshmgir

https://www.circularconversations.com/conversations/metamodern-values-for-a-listening-society

“​​Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well, or willingness to invest in enterprises that are obviously headed for early success, but, rather, an ability to work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed. The more unpropitious the situation in which we demonstrate hope, the deeper that hope is. Hope is definitely not the same thing as optimism. It is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out. In short, I think that the deepest and most important form of hope, the only one that can keep us above water and urge us to good works, and the only true source of the breathtaking dimension of the human spirit and its efforts, is something we get, as it were, from “elsewhere.” It is also this hope, above all, which gives us the strength to live and continually to try new things, even in conditions that seem as hopeless as ours do, here and now.”

 Note : We made it a series, and will keep designing the space as per the evolving conversations. To keep the space intentional we kept it to 15 people, but if you think you might be interested in joining us we will be very happy to have you with us. Drop a line to either of us via slack/email.

Joel Alexander (Kb5 fellow) and Tanaya (KB4 fellow and KB5 Guide)
