Event.title: NFTeasy
Event.descriptionHtml:
Write your own production-ready NFT contract and learn about trade-offs, the real poetry of cooperation, and how to build Babel with mirth. Intended for developers just starting to learn about web3

Everybody and their pet penguin has an NFT project these days. This is one of the features of open and permissionless technology: it’s wonderful until everyone starts using it, at which point it immediately feels overwhelming. But don’t grieve, dear heart, nor fear the seeming: here is waking in the dreaming.

We’ll run through the tools you need to start writing your own contracts and consider whether it’s even interesting at all to create non-fungible digital items. This will not immediately make you into a shadowy super coder, but it will give you the skills and knowledge to understand, analyse and navigate the less fungible and supposedly more permanent parts of web3.

There will be four lessons, and each will last for ~2hours, as the intention is to have a lot of space for shared explorations, questions, and a calm approach to learning about a new world.

Read more here
Event.descriptionText: Write your own production-ready NFT contract and learn about trade-offs, the real poetry of cooperation, and how to build Babel with mirth. Intended for developers just starting to learn about web3

Event.title: Elevating Web3 UX part 2
Event.descriptionHtml: This Junto will continue our conversation on how we can make the Web3 experience simple enough for the non-crypto inclined, but also powerful enough to support the most seasoned of Ethereum veterans. Some ideas we had proposed for the last Junto and surely did not get to most of them in the hour. Let's continue next week! Our conversation may start with onboarding, familiarising new “Ethereans” with wallets, their benefits as well as risks and how to ensure that tradeoffs made for usability do not compromise security. Another topic may then be especially the challenge of social applications build on Ethereum, where monetary incentives are at first not as predominant as in many other web 3 related applications, but could become a future challenge. Finally we may ask what types of “dark patterns” present in web 2 UX could be avoided as we rebuild the web. With Hester Bruikman product, UX, Design @ethstatus and the UX/design from akasha.org currently building akasha.ethereum.world we will have several interesting guests in this Junto joining us in KB4. Feel free to DM me or bring along your most pressing questions! Looking forward! Yours, Martin

Event.title: New Moon Ceremony
Event.descriptionHtml:
The New Moon is the perfect time for sowing seeds in your life. Setting intentions with the tender New Moon, allows them to grow as the Moon waxes and fills. Aligning ourselves with the cycles of the Moon, helps us to further overstand our own cycles.

Let's sow seeds together as Kernel family, this New Moon and fulljoy both Her darkness and Her light!🌜💚💛❤️

Please bring fire (a candle or otherwise), paper & pen, a potted plant, a little bit of water to prepare well for the ceremony. The full event is 90 minutes, but you are welcome to drop off after 60 minutes if it is best for you.

Event.title: Outsmarting Contracts
Event.descriptionHtml:
Write your own production-ready NFT contract and learn about trade-offs, the real poetry of cooperation, and how to build Babel with mirth. Intended for developers just starting to learn about web3.

We will be running through a smart contract course created by OpenZeppelin, the team responsible for writing the most widely used and trusted smart contract libraries, and also one of the most respected audit and security firms in web3.

This guild is intended mostly for people who have never seen a smart contract before. It's not going to make you into a shadowy super coder, but it is going to introduce you to how networks like Ethereum actually work and uncover many of the more subtle aspects which are often skipped over in glib media pieces about the 'future of money' or whatever other attention-grabbing title works best in that days A/B test.

There will be four lessons, and each will last for ~2hours, as the intention is to have a lot of space for shared explorations, questions, and a calm approach to learning about a new world.
Event.descriptionText: Write your own production-ready NFT contract and learn about trade-offs, the real poetry of cooperation, and how to build Babel with mirth. Intended for developers just starting to learn about web3. We will be running through a smart contract course created by OpenZeppelin, the team responsible for writing the most widely used and trusted smart contract libraries, and also one of the most respected audit and security firms in web3. There will be four lessons, and each will last for ~2hours, as the intention is to have a lot of space for shared explorations, questions, and a calm approach to learning about a new world.

Event.descriptionHtml:
The Web 3 Communities Guild (with IDEO) will help teams explore tokenized community principles and structures which enable communities to build, maintain and own projects over the long term.

Event.title: Zodiac & DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
Explore open tools and new kinds of multichain collaboration within and between DAOs. This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

This build guild is intended as a deep dive into a future where we co-develop open tools for more valuable collaboration. In order to do that, we'll start by going all the way back to the beginning of cooperatives and beyond. Everyone is welcome to join this first conversational session, which will introduce the above and explore the possibilities for culture in The Guilded Age.

In Sessions II, III and IV, we'll be taking a selected group of people through Zodiac: what it is, how to use it, and how to build new stuff for everyone with it. The only criteria for joining this session is that you must be willing to teach others in your block what you learn by hosting your own session at some stage. This is how p2p learning propagates.

Read more here

Event.title: How might we decentralize AI Part 2
Event.descriptionHtml: We had a great turnout (13 people!) last time with so much energy. This is a continuation of the conversation about decentralizing AI, whether it's a good idea and how Web3 might help. We are also hoping to experiment with some other formats this week and next. We'll host a hacking session with live data science using Web3 tools this Thursday (at least the first week of this will be no-code UI-based so suitable for non-technical people interested in data science/AI on Web3). We also hope to host a Miro design session next week, perhaps on what people hope to get from this new community. Stay tuned for the junto announcements!

Event.title: Meditation Cooler Ritual
Event.descriptionHtml: Coming out of All Souls Day, Day of the Dead, into COP26 & Kernel last home sprint, I hope to hold an interstitial space for Rebirthing so we don't recreate what is already destroying life on earth. (I might do a soft death meditation guidance) In https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wicked_problem#Super_wicked_problems, we often "discount the future irrationally". Therefore I hold in my heart the climate striking kids I know who would be at COP26, transforming the despair underlying to rage into prayers. Prayers of a timely paradigm shift ushered in by all your Kernel adventures. :pray: If you find hour-long silent meditation or any of these topics intimidating, please reach out to me ahead of time :heart: we're here for your life too.

Event.title: Block 5 Potentials
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hello Guides,

We will be conducting 16 rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from Dec 2 - Dec 14.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB5 fellows for each round.

  • Day 1: Thursday (Dec 2): Play of Pattern, Trust
  • Day 2: Friday (Dec 3): Meaning, Value
  • Day 3: Monday (Dec 6): Asking Better Questions, Money & Speech
  • Day 4: Tuesday (Dec 7): Intention, Freedom
  • Day 5: Wednesday (Dec 8): Govern Yourself, Liberally Radical
  • Day 6: Thursday (Dec 9): Incentives, Listening
  • Day 7: Monday (Dec 13): Censorship Resistance, Learn
  • Day 8: Tuesday (Dec 14): Giving, Scalability

You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

Event.title: CryptoECOnomics | Kernel for young climate striking generation
Event.descriptionHtml: Cohosting an online COP 10-12 Nov on https://sparklever.se prompted me to think "who is it for?" Speaking to Greta's generation during the Youth Climate Summit inspired me and yet like them, what happened after despaired me. Kernel reignited what's possible... Some of them shared that they wished they had a mentor to navigate the complexity ahead. How might they gain cryptoeconomics tools (even 2mo UBI funding) and wisdom/wellbeing practices to achieve escape velocity from replicating the global financial system again? For us, how might we deeply listen to Greta's clock so we arrive at truthful conversations, arrive at now, and arrive at you. (Join meditation junto before this to breath :) together #conspire)

Event.title: OpenCOP Lightning Talks || Composting Meditation
Event.descriptionHtml:
Get your conf pass ahead with code: chipunk

eventbrite.com/e/opencop-tickets-201591293987

Set in sparklever.se that has held BurningMan for the past 2 years, come with lightning talks of your Kernel adventures.

5min cool takes* on how your adventure can cool your mind or harmonize relations with others/nature (1st/2nd/3rd order effects welcomed).

We will also hear from young climate activists at COP26 (+compost away their frustration), start and end with meditation to compost our hot takes to fertilizing cool takes. Together, we will navigate Spaceship Earth following the little Signs of Life contributed by each of your senses.

*Slacking your cool take presentation ahead of time is recommended to ensure safe navigation.

Event.title: Non-transferable NFTs in Art and Music
Event.descriptionHtml:
Following up on Vitalik's article "Soulbound" - this junto aims to explore

a) potential advantages and disadvantages of soul binding NFT's for art, artists, and their communities

b) what has been done in the space

c) technological challenges (wallet fraud...)

Please note I am a newbie to web 3 but an experienced community builder and performer

I have been pondering this idea of soulbound NFTs since I read the article and would LOVE a discussion around this, especially with NFT "veterans"

The proposed meeting time is a bit on short notice (it's on Thurs 3-17) so might move it but trying to keep the momentum going! ;)

link to the article:

https://vitalik.ca/general/2022/01/26/soulbound.html

Event.title: Sovereignty and Privacy Jam 3
Event.descriptionHtml:
This is part 3 of our ongoing series leading to a framework for evaluating privacy on the blockchain and emerging digital worlds. If you plan to participate, please message me (Anastasia Uglova) for access to the draft white paper we are using as guidance. You can also email me (anastasiau@gmail.com).

I'm allocating two hours but plan is to be done in 1.5 hours.

Soft goal: Self-assign usecases for privacy according to the framework in the white paper. Or, if we determine our time is best used otherwise, also good!

Event.descriptionHtml:
What are the existing and emerging design patterns in web3 architectures?

What are the big open questions in this space?

How can we learn from mistakes and build better?

Want to learn with others. As always - I don't have the answers, just trying to pose the right questions.

Event.title: Health optimisation in web3
Event.descriptionHtml:
How can web3 help us live a long, healthy life?

There are many directions we could go with this. Some potential starting points:

  • What does a healthy life mean to you?

  • What are the main challenges for living a healthy life in 2022?

  • How might we use web3 incentives to help people live healthily?

  • How might we use web3 to increase access to healthcare?
Event.descriptionText:
How can web3 help us live a long, healthy life?

There are many directions we could go with this. Some potential starting points:

What does a healthy life mean to you?

What are the main challenges for living a healthy life in 2022?

How might we use web3 incentives to help people live healthily?

How might we use web3 to increase access to healthcare?

Event.title: London Kernel meet up at the Kernel Brewery
Event.descriptionHtml:
The Kernel Brewery Taproom, Arch 7, Dockley Road Industrial Estate, Dockley Rd, London SE16 3FJ

"Each brew is an intentional evolving of the previous batch."

Kernel people meet in Kernel brewery - it's all very meta.

Missed the first meet up? Here's the second London meetup for Kernel people - this time at the Kernel Brewery.

About The Kernel Brewery: Founded in 2009 by Evin O'Riordain in Bermondsey, England, Kernel Brewery was one of London's first craft brewers. The brewery's ethos strongly favours quality over quantity. It has helped inspire the establishment of around a hundred new microbreweries.

How to start your own brewery

Event.title: Zodiac & DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
Explore open tools and new kinds of multichain collaboration within and between DAOs. This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

This build guild is intended as a deep dive into a future where we co-develop open tools for more valuable collaboration. In order to do that, we'll start by going all the way back to the beginning of cooperatives and beyond. Everyone is welcome to join this first conversational session, which will introduce the above and explore the possibilities for culture in The Guilded Age.

In Sessions II, III and IV, we'll be taking a selected group of people through Zodiac: what it is, how to use it, and how to build new stuff for everyone with it. The only criteria for joining this session is that you must be willing to teach others in your block what you learn by hosting your own session at some stage. This is how p2p learning propagates.

Read more here

This constellation of conversation, resources and practical skills has been created by the Gnosis Guild team behind Zodiac and is intended for people at least somewhat familiar with DAOs, who want to understand and contribute to the evolution of new cultural tools

Event.title: KB4 Unofficial Showcase aka AltShowcase
Event.descriptionHtml: Welcome to the Unofficial KERNEL Block 4 AltShowcase, aka the feedback pay-it-forward. Nothing beats the pressure of purposely presenting to an audience; nothing prepares you better for life than exposing your true self to your KERNEL Fellows; nothing is more valuable than receiving loving, honest, and true feedback from people with loosely shared interests. For those and other reasons, come and share your adventure in precisely timed 4-5 minutes intervals; receive and give asynchronous feedback; and collectively grow the forest KERNEL is destined to be. The only price to pay is to give feedback to another adventure. Simply, fill out this form: https://forms.gle/6RZ4ozxGi4Us1QuN7, to answer these questions Problem: 1-4 Solution: 1-4 Clarity and conciseness: 1-4 Technical Feasibility: 1-4 Is this web3 or web2? True or False Do you know someone who can help this adventure? True or False Do you wanna schedule a more intimate call? True or False Other comments: Open Hopefully, this will be the first of many alternative showcases. If the day and time doesn't work, let's meet again next week.

Event.title: Basic income; bounties; salaries; and other compensation mechanisms for awesome DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
How might we compensate contributors in a fair way? How might we foster exploration and infinite game mindset among our contributors? How might we cultivate belonging and stewardship in our contributors' hearts? How might we allow for flexible time commitment levels? How might we focus on long-term building and maintain short-term responsiveness to urgent issues?

We'll be recording this meeting for those who cannot make it.

Event.title: Scaling translations for web3
Event.descriptionHtml:
In this Junto we would like to explore how to scale translations in web3 putting as a first use-case the Kernel Syllabus.

Join us to ponder

  1. How might we scale translations without compromising quality of those translations?

  2. What would be a good quality control process look like?

  3. Might it make sense to create a BabelDao (suggested by Ali) of translators and language enthusiast which offers services to other guilds, DAOs, communities, products, etc.?

Event.title: Token Communities
Event.descriptionHtml: Collaborate with your peers to map and visualise token economies you’re interested in learning more about. Hosted by Reuben from IDEO and Michael from KB4 and HERE, this guild votes on tokens or economies we’d all like to understand better and then spends their sessions co-creating Figma boards which, through better questions, literally map the flows of value in each system. Occasionally special guests will join in the fun, but the focus is always on shared sense-making.

Event.title: Akashic Kernel - Securing Prosociality
Event.descriptionHtml:
We are lucky to have some wonderful people from Akasha adventuring with us into the wilder parts of the web3 social web. This call explores how to federate prosocial tools and bridge different contexts with shared patterns that do not impose.

Akasha was one of the very first dapps on Ethereum and has a long and storied history which we will be lucky to learn from.

Running notes can be found here: https://www.notion.so/Kernel-AKASHA-Exploration-log-6dcab5590432419e922ef87a3a3358d8

Event.title: Pitch Bingo
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hey everyone!

Gitcoin Grants GR14, EthCC5 conference, Kernel Showcase, and a lot more opportunities to talk about our projects are approaching, it’s time to pimp our pitches!

Pitch Bingo is a fun 2-hour peer-review format for doing rapid iteration on pitches (introduced by our fellow kerneling Salim). We will each pitch 3+ times, each time getting very structured feedback designed to make us fix one thing at a time.

You can join to pitch, or just to hear pitches and give feedback. (Every short pitch is followed by a vote and rapid-fire questions from the audience, which helps the presenter understand what was understood.)

You can also join #jam-perfect-pitch-practitioners to continue the conversation on Slack!

Event.title: DAO Soft Governance Jam
Event.descriptionHtml:
Within the world of DAO Governance, much of our emphasis remains on what we might call "hard governance". Hard governance takes the form of technical solutions that allow us to run our orgs more autonomously.

But what about the human element of DAOs?

Most of our energy is focused on hard governance, even though most of our decisions require "soft governance".

Soft governance requires less structured solutions. It is emergent. It is messy. It is human. Effective soft governance requires personal mastery and excellent communication. It requires a level of humility and growth orientation.

How do we surface and nurture the importance of soft governance in a meaningful way?

Join us for the first of many conversations to help surface, define, and proliferate a movement that refocuses the importance of soft governance best practices in Web3.

Co-hosted by @Ben @Jonathan Miller @Laura Banks
Event.descriptionText:
Within the world of DAO Governance, much of our emphasis remains on what we might call "hard governance". Hard governance takes the form of technical solutions that allow us to run our orgs more autonomously. 

But what about the human element of DAOs? 

Most of our energy is focused on hard governance, even though most of our decisions require "soft governance".

Soft governance requires less structured solutions. It is emergent. It is messy. It is human. Effective soft governance requires personal mastery and excellent communication. It requires a level of humility and growth orientation. 

How do we surface and nurture the importance of soft governance in a meaningful way?

Join us for the first of many conversations to help surface, define, and proliferate a movement that refocuses the importance of soft governance best practices in Web3. 

Co-hosted by @Ben @Jonathan Miller @Laura Banks

Event.title: [Meditation Guild] Interbeing towards cooling earth-mind-ReFi
Event.descriptionHtml:
In our lovely first meditation guild session with Vince Horn (who spoke at Schelling Point) & our own Andy Tudhope, the irl dicussion surfaced the importance of rebundling our meditation practice with ethics.

In this week's session, we will be practicing with potential special guests from International Network of Engaged Buddhists (with their practice of addressing structural suffering), GitcoinDAO (someone involved in catalysing dharmadao), BuddhistGeeks, and you, interbeing in the midst of crises. Finding little signs of what gives life together.

https://theecologist.org/2019/jun/10/engaged-buddhism

❤

Event.title: Deep Dive - Grant Funding
Event.descriptionHtml:
A part of #jam-funding

On the heels of GR13, we'll be deep diving into all things grants.

  • What sorts of grants are available in the Web3 landscape?

  • Behind-the-scenes: How are grants written? What goes into consideration when an entity decides to give grants? Why are there so many grants?

  • OK there are so many grants, which ones should I apply for?!

  • How important is it for the grant providing entity's vision/purpose to align with the project's?

  • And more

Event.title: Pitch Bingo
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hey everyone!

Gitcoin Grants GR14, EthCC5 conference, Kernel Showcase, and a lot more opportunities to talk about our projects are approaching, it’s time to pimp our pitches!

Pitch Bingo is a fun 2-hour peer-review format for doing rapid iteration on pitches (introduced by our fellow kerneling Salim). We will each pitch 3+ times, each time getting very structured feedback designed to make us fix one thing at a time.

You can join to pitch, or just to hear pitches and give feedback. (Every short pitch is followed by a vote and rapid-fire questions from the audience, which helps the presenter understand what was understood.)

You can also join #jam-perfect-pitch-practitioners to continue the conversation on Slack!

Event.title: On Consent and Contestability
Event.descriptionHtml:
A knowledge-sharing session about what meaningful consent and contestability means to you and what it could look like for the way we interact with AI systems. 🙌💫💥

I'll start by sharing about some work on AI transparency building blocks as part of my Trustworthy AI fellowship at Mozilla and then we will engage in an interactive workshop.

Depending on where the open discussion takes us, we can explore the use of computational contracts to enable open and transparent mechanisms for consent and contestability in the context of the way we interact with algorithmic systems.

THANK YOU & really looking forward to connecting 🙏

Your committed kernelian, @bobirakova

Event.title: Relationship-first thinking | Getting to know each other before committing to long-term creative projects
Event.descriptionHtml:
How might we find human/culture fit? How might we test our collective bonds and communication skills? How might we find a common vision and shared purpose to assemble with compatible collaborators? How might we get to know each other in an authentic way and build trust? How might we lay the necessary foundations as a team to finish the projects we start? Why have our previous collaborations failed?

The conversation will be recorded.

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel
Event.descriptionHtml:
This is a recurring weekly call we have that is open to anyone in the Kernel community who wants to see how we work and what ongoing projects they can contribute to.

We welcome all levels of experience and all different backgrounds. However, the focus of the call is generally technical reporting, goal setting for the week to come and general discussion and feedback of ongoing coding and infrastructure development for communities of care.

Event.title: Pitch Bingo
Event.descriptionHtml:
What to quickly improve your Gitcoin Grants page or Kernel Pitch Deck?

This is a fun 2-hour peer-review format for doing rapid iteration on pitches. We will each pitch 3+ times, each time getting very structured feedback designed to make us fix one thing at a time.

You can join to pitch, or just to hear pitches and give feedback. (Every short pitch is followed by a vote and rapid-fire questions from the audience, which helps the presenter understand what was understood.)

This format comes from my previous work in startup education. One session usually gets people into the top 3 on accelerator demo days, and I used it to prep engineers to get BBC coverage a few years running.  For us a Kernel, I've worked up a web3 version that I hope helps Kernel projects stand out in the current Gitcoin round.

It's usually an in-person workshop but I've stuck it with some basic instructions into a figma board here if you want to check it out first.

Here's the original thread on Slack. (I'll post more sessions later, but just wanted to get a quick session in before the last Expo Day)

Event.title: From hopeless human to greenpilled regen
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Activape during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

Activape is an onboarding tool to transform hopeless humans into greenpilled regens acting together for public goods.

Humanity is facing the greatest crisis of its short existence, and yet most humans are either hopeless, traumatized, or in denial, while those that would like to do something often feel impotent and alone within a system that’s built to resist change.

Web3 has the potential to become a schelling point for the hopeful, but the barriers to entry are still too high. Many get lost in the complexity and end up abandoning the adventure.

Today’s ImpactDAOs and NGOs face common challenges

  • Attract engaged and diverse contributors

  • Improve the time to first meaningful contribution and first payment

  • Empower contributors to act autonomously

Today’s citizens have common needs

  • Find your causes and your people

  • Get rewarded for your positive impact

  • Start acting today for what you care about

Useful documents

  • Brainstorming

  • Pitchdeck

Preliminary program

  1. Why? OKRs? KPIs?

  2. TBD

  3. TBD

  4. Tokenomics? Activist Ikigai NFTs? $ACTIV token? Wen???

  5. TBD

  6. TBD

  7. Preparing for EthCC

  8. TBD

  9. TBD

Event.title: Toronto IRL Kernel Dinner
Event.descriptionHtml:
This Thursday, we invite the Toronto/GTA Kernel community to join us for an IRL Dinner at 25 Ordnance St in Liberty Village. Let's enjoy a shared meal, conversation & good times. Setting a cap of 15 for now, but happy to make more room as required. Come as you are. Dinner will be provided.

BYOB if you absolutely must, but it's not recommended actually because open alcohol isn't allowed at this event. But if you absolutely feel the need to drink alcohol, then please bring it in a discreet fashion like in a water bottle or flask. Thank you.

Also please give me a call/text at 6477163730 upon arrival at the building so I can let you in/up. My full name is Tian-Yuan Zhao.

“We learn from each other, and we give of ourselves until self and other lose the sense of separation which so often rules our interactions. And in this is a truth which cannot be given or received, it can only be grown in your own heart as you come to trust in the inalienable value of who you already are.” - cryptowanderer

Event.title: Venture DAOs part 1 - a history
Event.descriptionHtml:
This is part 1 of a series of juntos on venture DAOs (tbd about future juntos). We'll discuss the history of venture DAOs starting with MolochDAO, Metacartel Ventures and The LAO.

Required readings:

  1. MolochDAO v2 readme: https://github.com/MolochVentures/moloch#readme 

  2. Metacartel Ventures whitepaper: https://github.com/metacartel/MCV/blob/master/Whitepaper.pdf 

  3. The LAO docs: https://docs.thelao.io/ 

Optional readings:

  1. MolochDAO v1 readme: https://github.com/MolochVentures/moloch/tree/minimal-revenue/v1_contracts#readme 

  2. Metacartel Ventures launch announcement: https://cryptobriefing.com/metacartel-launches-dao-based-venture-fund/ 

  3. The LAO audit report: https://consensys.net/diligence/audits/2020/01/the-lao/ 

No promise to schedule junto parts 2 and 3, all depends on my bandwidth to do so or if someone else wants to take the helm!

Categories for future juntos on the broader topic of venture DAOs:

  1. New kids on the block: Flamingo, Neon, Pleasr, Ready Player, Nouns

  2. Platforms for venture DAOs: Tribute Labs, Syndicate

  3. DAO incubators: ConsenSys Mesh / Tachyon, Outlier Ventures, Cabin, DeFi Wonderland, Buidl Guild

Event.title: Whats in a meme-rescheduled. How Web3 marketing differs from Web2
Event.descriptionHtml:
Web3 marketing. All meme-or is there more?

We will be using this miro link to collaborate.

https://miro.com/welcomeonboard/ak9YVnJvN1R3bUN1S3l4UjAxblF5YzJIbnVLNkdKTjJhVVN5NFl1NXQ2eDIxWkVqcjVEYUY3b2xmUmNFOFFiTHwzNDU4NzY0NTE4OTgzODk3MTIx?invite_link_id=614889186431

Please note that I am reschedule this meeting that I had originally proposed on 10/17 @ 2pm EST.

How does Web3 marketing differ from Web2?

Helping out with Sam He's migrantsnft.xyz/ launch on March 31, I started to ask . . . what does marketing in Web3 look like?

Is it just Twitter? Are they airdrops? And marketing assets just memes?

Much like the conversation we had earlier regarding Web2 vs Web3 product management, I am curious to hear peoples thoughts on marketing and how or if it differs from a Web3 world

I'd love to hear from some people directly ahead of this call to better prepare for this Junto and setup appropriate artifacts.

Please DM me!

Event.title: FOOD and WEB3 - how | where | why
Event.descriptionHtml:
Do you like food, are deep in the web3 matrix - how the heck do we bring these things together. Kevin Jiang (cafeteria DAO) and I (ex fermentation teacher interested in education through play) are proposing a broad junto around web3 & food. Come join us and lets figure some of the madness out.

Food+Eating use cases in the WEB3 ecosystems?

community building & sustainability?

redistribution of funds?

web3 games for food education?

what does incentive alignment look like?

crypto versions of consumer goods?
Event.descriptionText:

what does incentive alignment look like? 

crypto versions of consumer goods?

Event.title: From hopeless human to greenpilled regen
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Activape during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

Activape is an onboarding tool to transform hopeless humans into greenpilled regens acting together for public goods.

Humanity is facing the greatest crisis of its short existence, and yet most humans are either hopeless, traumatized, or in denial, while those that would like to do something often feel impotent and alone within a system that’s built to resist change.

Web3 has the potential to become a schelling point for the hopeful, but the barriers to entry are still too high. Many get lost in the complexity and end up abandoning the adventure.

Today’s ImpactDAOs and NGOs face common challenges

  • Attract engaged and diverse contributors

  • Improve the time to first meaningful contribution and first payment

  • Empower contributors to act autonomously

Today’s citizens have common needs

  • Find your causes and your people

  • Get rewarded for your positive impact

  • Start acting today for what you care about

Useful documents

  • Brainstorming

  • Pitchdeck

Preliminary program

  1. Why? OKRs? KPIs?

  2. TBD

  3. TBD

  4. Tokenomics? Activist Ikigai NFTs? $ACTIV token? Wen???

  5. TBD

  6. TBD

  7. Preparing for EthCC

  8. TBD

  9. TBD

Event.title: Gaming Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel. Conceptual analysis is left for your own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision and create a better web together.
Event.descriptionText:
The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and
re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating
over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel.
Conceptual analysis [https://kernel.community/en/build/games/] is left for your
own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many
imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision
and create a better web together.

Event.title: Gather Cafe Coworking Fridays
Event.descriptionHtml:
Let's hang out in the new cat/pup cafe & ramen shop adjacent to the KERNEL main space. (Get there via the "To the Cafe" arrows along the right-side wall of the Library.)

You can come to work quietly on your own thing, or to find others to chat with, or both. You can come and go as you please. The only purpose of the 3-hour time window is that I (Rory) or someone else will commit to being there during the specified times, so that you won't be there by yourself.

To respect each other's preferences for how we'd like to be interacted with, we observe the house rules, which you can find below. (Also posted on signs in the cafe and ramen shop.)

Chill at the counter, settle in on a couch, or claim a dual-monitor desk. Enjoy a cortado and a pastry, or loose-leaf tea and a bowl of tonkotsu ramen. Get stuff done and make new friends. Hope to see you there!

-----

this space is meant to serve people who want to interact AND people who want to hang out without necessarily interacting. to that end, a few house rules to keep in mind:

+ first: to define, conceptually, a few major modes of using this space (these aren't defined in gather but are our own desired conventions):

+ "let's talk!" means one is open to conversations of any length. if someone is in "let's talk!" mode, they are saying you can go up to them and start talking to them by voice/video, ring them if they're idle, and have an open-ended conversation.

+ "say hi" means one is open to saying hi and to short conversations (< 10 minutes or so). you can still ring this person, but keep in mind they may be busy with something.

+ "in the zone", "heads down", or "do not disturb" means to please not initiate a voice conversation with this person right now.

+ the above modes apply to voice/video chat. regardless of mode, you can always feel free to use the text chat to message "everyone", "nearby", or to DM people. any user can disable "Chat sounds" in their settings, if chat messages are too distracting.

+ please set your own status line (in the bottom bar) to say "let's talk!", "say hi", or "in the zone" (etc) according to the above (or a custom message), and keep it up to date.

+ please do your best to respect others' status line messages.

+ anywhere other than in labelled quiet zones, if you can't figure out someone's status, assume the default is "say hi." within quiet zones, assume the default is "in the zone."

+ you can also use gather's Do Not Disturb feature (same menu as where you edit the status line) to ensure you are not disturbed, but then you also can't walk, chat, or do anything else.

+ unlike in the Library, there are not a lot of "private spaces" in this space, which means that others nearby may be able to faintly overhear your conversation. to have a more isolated conversation, try the Library (via the teleporter).

thanks for your company, and enjoy!

+ unlike in the Library, there are not a lot of "private spaces" in this space, which means that others nearby may be able to faintly overhear your conversation. to have a more isolated conversation, try the Library (via the teleporter).

thanks for your company, and enjoy!
Event.descriptionText:
Let's hang out in the new cat/pup cafe & ramen shop adjacent to the KERNEL main space. (Get there via the "To the Cafe" arrows along the right-side wall of the Library.)

You can come to work quietly on your own thing, or to find others to chat with, or both. You can come and go as you please. The only purpose of the 3-hour time window is that I (Rory) or someone else will commit to being there during the specified times, so that you won't be there by yourself.

To respect each other's preferences for how we'd like to be interacted with, we observe the house rules, which you can find below. (Also posted on signs in the cafe and ramen shop.)

Chill at the counter, settle in on a couch, or claim a dual-monitor desk. Enjoy a cortado and a pastry, or loose-leaf tea and a bowl of tonkotsu ramen. Get stuff done and make new friends. Hope to see you there!

-----

this space is meant to serve people who want to interact AND people who want to hang out without necessarily interacting. to that end, a few house rules to keep in mind:

+ first: to define, conceptually, a few major modes of using this space (these aren't defined in gather but are our own desired conventions):

    + "let's talk!" means one is open to conversations of any length. if someone is in "let's talk!" mode, they are saying you can go up to them and start talking to them by voice/video, ring them if they're idle, and have an open-ended conversation.

    + "say hi" means one is open to saying hi and to short conversations (< 10 minutes or so). you can still ring this person, but keep in mind they may be busy with something.

    + "in the zone", "heads down", or "do not disturb" means to please not initiate a voice conversation with this person right now.

+ the above modes apply to voice/video chat. regardless of mode, you can always feel free to use the text chat to message "everyone", "nearby", or to DM people. any user can disable "Chat sounds" in their settings, if chat messages are too distracting.

+ please set your own status line (in the bottom bar) to say "let's talk!", "say hi", or "in the zone" (etc) according to the above (or a custom message), and keep it up to date.

+ please do your best to respect others' status line messages.

+ anywhere other than in labelled quiet zones, if you can't figure out someone's status, assume the default is "say hi." within quiet zones, assume the default is "in the zone."

+ you can also use gather's Do Not Disturb feature (same menu as where you edit the status line) to ensure you are not disturbed, but then you also can't walk, chat, or do anything else.

+ unlike in the Library, there are not a lot of "private spaces" in this space, which means that others nearby may be able to faintly overhear your conversation. to have a more isolated conversation, try the Library (via the teleporter).

thanks for your company, and enjoy!

Event.title: Dominican Women in Saving Circiles
Event.descriptionHtml: In mid-April, I will be working in the Dominican Republic with five+ groups of women who participate in active, ongoing saving circles (a well established program - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8cCz69hsTWM.) They save often to support their small businesses. I will be looking for ways to extend opportunities to them and their businesses through connections outside of DR. Perhaps you have ideas?

Event.title: Gaming Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel. Conceptual analysis is left for your own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision and create a better web together.

over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel.
Conceptual analysis [https://kernel.community/en/build/games/] is left for your
own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many
imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision
and create a better web together.

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel
Event.descriptionHtml:
This is a recurring weekly call we have that is open to anyone in the Kernel community who wants to see how we work and what ongoing projects they can contribute to.

We welcome all levels of experience and all different backgrounds. However, the focus of the call is generally technical reporting, goal setting for the week to come and general discussion and feedback of ongoing coding and infrastructure development for communities of care.

Event.title: Meditation with Marlon
Event.descriptionHtml:
Marlon Barrios Solano, a certified Vipassana meditation teacher, has kindly offered to host 1 hour meditation sessions once a week for the duration of our empty block.

Simply come, and we can investigate together that nature of emptiness and enjoy the harmony of silence.

You need nothing to join these sessions. No prior experience is required, nor will we promote any particular technique. We will just sit together and share some small moments before and after to set the context and help integrate our shared experiences.

Event.title: BEING THE WEB 3 -  Embodying the KB5 Flow
Event.descriptionHtml:
BEING THE WEB 3

Embodying the KB5 Flow

Part 1: Mapping the body-mind journey

Following up and watching many of the recordings, it came clear to me the idea that this approach can be of service to the community as an ideation method and as part of the Kernel journey. Would love to open up space for the reflection through the inner presence design approach, Design-Being.

I propose an encounter with the unheard language of the body as a silent witness beneath all words that have been said during this journey and let it speak. Following on the words mentioned about ” the healing patterns as a discovery process, in uncensored learning and grounded in the inner desires, the more agency as a gift to the individual, the more collective action without losing sovereignty, feeling one with nature in the enjoyable environment”

A guided journey to reflect on the Kernel experience through inner presence, to give space and voice to our body-mind rich source of meaning and sense-making. We will explore a body-centric design approach that expands strategy and focus from other ideation approaches, based on transformative embodied experiential methods and practices, and then applies them in real-life projects.

Reference:

http://thefactofexisting.simplesite.com/451911586

A second part will follow, the idea is to create a recurring space to explore this realm of the body-mind connection. Everybody is welcome!

Event.descriptionHtml: There is a capacity limit of 7 at the restaurant. If you are interested but capacity is already reached ping me on slack.

Event.title: Jam - Funding Narratives
Event.descriptionHtml:
How are narratives changing around funding? How do we want the narrative to change? A special jam session with KB3 fellow Rumi.

We'll also get into the nuances of Web3 funding cultures, such as:

  • How do VCs perceive and deal with anon founders? How do founders perceive and deal with anon investors?

On Capital-founder fit:

  • What are the typical and different capital structures of VCs?

  • What are the peculiarities in structures of companies in Web3?

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel - Summer of Love Edition
Event.descriptionHtml:
In which we gather to build open infrastructure for communities of care.

Playing together we explore, discuss, and experiment with some technical patterns intended to support infinite games. What kind of tools to we want to work with to create peer learning environments, and how do we want to organize around both their making and use?

These quest(ion)s and more await you. To access the notes, first:

Make a wallet here: https://staging.wallet.kernel.community/register

Unprofile yourself here: https://staging.unprofile.kernel.community/

Notes here: https://staging.adventures.kernel.community/view/kbk

Event.title: LUV Art Wellness
Event.descriptionHtml:
Art Wellness Session

A dedicated space for KERNEL and friends to practice the art of love through therapeutic dialogue. The conversation will be held on Google Meet with co-hosts Anbessa, Rumi and Tagan.

We invite chefs: counselors, therapist, sound healers, herbal healers, neuroscientists, physicists, yogis, fitness trainers and sacred knowledge researchers

Event.title: IRL Dinner at El Salvaje Miami

El Salvaje, 101 NE 34th St, Miami, 7:30 pm local time.

Event.title: Free and Open Source Collaboration for Communities
Event.descriptionHtml:
In this KBK talk with Henry Zhu (https://www.henryzoo.com/), we explore how to cultivate a culture of free and open source collaboration in communities, especially at KERNEL where we are building increasingly ambitious projects in public! Babel's approach has been interesting in this space- https://github.com/sponsors/babel

We explore this in the spirit of #kernel-building-kernel

Let's sow seeds together as Kernel family, this New Moon and fulljoy both Her darkness and Her light!🌜💚💛❤️

Event.title: Kernel Principles Glass Bead Game
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for dialogic games structured around the Kernel principles. We'll likely try to play two rounds, using the next two principles: Shared truths create value and Develop the means to mean.

What is a Glass Bead Game?

Well, it comes from Herman Hesse's novel of the same name. Here are some quotes which should hopefully leave you asking better questions:

"The Glass Bead Game is an act of mental synthesis through which the spiritual values of all ages are perceived as simultaneously present and vitally alive."

"The Glass Bead Game is thus a mode of playing with the total contents and values of our culture; it plays with them as, say, in the great age of the arts a painter might have played with the colors on his palette."

"There is truth. But the doctrine you desire, absolute, perfect dogma that alone provides wisdom, does not exist. Nor should you long for a perfect doctrine, my friend. Rather, you should long for the perfection of yourself. The deity is with you, not in ideas and books. Truth is lived, not taught."

And one last one from our dear friend, Magister Ludi LCC, to straighten it all out:

"On the in breath, one contemplates the nature of the playground: the self as totality of being.

On the out breath, one meditates on the nature of the player: the self as pure consciousness."

Event.title: KERNEL Storytime
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL Storytime is a weekly gathering in the Empty Block where everyone is invited to share and listen to stories from the KERNEL family. We believe that stories can deepen our understanding of ourselves, each other, and the world around us. We think stories should be told and shared by many diverse voices. We hope Storytime will foster deep social bonds and greater understanding through human connection.  

The genesis of Storytime evolved from wanting more opportunities for cross-pollination and discovery among Blocks. We’re inspired by the potential of storytelling in our community, where your stories become tools to better understand the present and radically reimagine possible futures. We envision Storytime as a catalyst to explore ideas and experiment with alternative ways of doing and being collectively, as a catalyst to create communities of care. 

As Storytime is a new initiative, we have no set flow or format to share just yet. We’re embracing the ethos of the Empty Block: experimentation, reflection, and feedback. Our intention is to create a nurturing environment. One that feels healthy, warm, welcoming, and supportive. Feel free to reach out with any questions or ideas. 

Susie and Aliya are excited to go on this journey with all of you! Join us for one session or multiple sessions. Please bring yourself, an open mind and open heart. For on-going communications, join us in the Slack channel #kernel-storytime.

Please note these sessions will not be recorded. We hope to soon share asynchronous ways of participating, stay tuned!

Event.title: Benefits of Manifold Smart Contracts
Event.descriptionHtml:
Manifold, a creator-owned minting smart contract

Manifold is a no-code platform for developing a NFT smart contract. It lists a few benefits that we will discuss to reach a better understanding of what these benefits truly mean. Some of the benefits include:

-Free

-Open Source

-Authenticity — true provenance for creators

-Interoperability — works with existing ERC-721/1155 NFT platforms

-Extensibility — unique, creator-approved NFT applications

-Batch minting

-Admin dashboard

-Airdrops

-Royalty set up

This conversation is open to those looking to learn and those looking to share knowledge or both!

Helpful Links:

Manifold Creator

Manifold on Smart Contracts and Creative Sovereignty

Manifold.xyz

Zoom Password: luv

Event.title: Kernel Origin Story
Event.descriptionHtml:
A conversation on the origins our beloved Kernel community and how it has evolved.

There will be an initial discussion and after a Q&A session with the participants. Please post your questions here

  1. After being part Titans of Investing and co-founding Gitcoin, how did the idea of Kernel came to be?

  2. Words are important, what was about the word "Kernel" that spoke to you?

  3. How did you know that Andy was the person to write the syllabus?

  4. Why did had to be 8 modules? Similarly, how did you arrive to the 8 web 3 principles as well as personal principles?

  5. In which aspect has Kernel evolved from the genesis module to module 5? Which aspects have stayed the same?

  6. What are other stories that you would like to weave into (Kernel related and beyond)?

Motivating thread

This session will be recorded.

Event.title: CRYPTO SALON—Jonathan Harris of Church of Burn
Event.descriptionHtml:
The next Crypto Salon will be next Thursday, 26 May at 4pm BST.

We'll be joined by Jonathan Harris who will speak to us about the latest, crypto-related plans for Church of Burn, which organizes money-burning events. Here's a summary of what we'll be discussing: 

CoB is instituting as a religious charity and offering crypto tokens as a 'donor benefit'. The tokens will be linked via a smart contract to ownership of CoB's sacred objects; the physical artifacts used and venerated in our services and rituals. Each artifact will be on-chained with a Physical Asset Non-Fungible Token (PA-NFT). CoB will accept bids for PA-NFTs via a public auction site. Token holders can vote to accept (or reject) bids and will be entitled to a disbursement of the proceeds inline with their token holdings.

The Crypto Salon is a meetup for discussing the social/cultural aspects of crypto. Join our Telegram group!

Event.title: Walk-along multi-chain wallet and gitcoin set-up
Event.descriptionHtml:
It took me a while to figure out how to set up my wallet and gitcoin profile and donate to gitcoin grants (for all the awesome projects going on in kernel and beyond!).

I figured there will be others here also not super-comfortable with the whole process, so thought a walk-through could be helpful - both for donating to gitcoin grants and more generally.

Planning to go through:

  • connecting wallet to different chains (incl testnets)

  • different methods for transferring money into wallet

  • using DEXs to do exchanges

  • setting up gitcoin profile, forms of verification to increase matching (BrightID party, anyone?)

  • ETH vs polygon vs zkSync vs other

I (now) have some basic knowledge and ability with this - any further expertise much appreciated!

(If time, we can also talk about cool gitcoin projects that we’ve seen and are excited to support)
Event.descriptionText:
It took me a while to figure out how to set up my wallet and gitcoin profile and donate to gitcoin grants (for all the awesome projects going on in kernel and beyond!).

I figured there will be others here also not super-comfortable with the whole process, so thought a walk-through could be helpful - both for donating to gitcoin grants and more generally.

Planning to go through:

connecting wallet to different chains (incl testnets)

different methods for transferring money into wallet

using DEXs to do exchanges

setting up gitcoin profile, forms of verification to increase matching (BrightID party, anyone?)

ETH vs polygon vs zkSync vs other

I (now) have some basic knowledge and ability with this - any further expertise much appreciated!

(If time, we can also talk about cool gitcoin projects that we’ve seen and are excited to support)

Event.title: From KYC to know-your-neighbor
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Solidarity during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

We are building a citizen-led global basic income, based on a compounding web of trust and care that is created through the recording of authentic conversations between neighbors.

Context

SolidarityCard is evolving. In the beginning, we talked about a debit card for homeless and undocumented people. However, it was never intended to be exclusively for them, but for everyone.

Since we initially focused our communication around helping this population, many people misunderstood the need to record our conversations and the essential role of these recordings to provide an alternative to KYC. Furthermore, convincing governments to try this alternative and being able to issue debit cards to people without official documents and proof-of-address is going to take some time.

Liberating ourselves from poverty is not simply a financial matter, it is also about liberating our minds from the idea that poverty and inequality are acceptable conditions in our society. We have built all our social structures based on the narrative that humans are valuable for what they produce and that being successful means owning more than the others with which we are in competition. But narratives can be rewritten and societies can be transformed.

Ultimately, our goal is neither a debit card, nor a web of trust, not even a basic income, but social cohesion and long-term thinking at a global scale.

Initiatives

After tons of illuminating exchanges with your brilliant minds we now think that we can start building everything else before the card. If we break apart the different blocks in a well thought out manner, they can start creating value for all our Web3 projects and also for society at large.

These are some of the initiatives we think could be useful for this stage:

  • Activator App

  • Identity Certificate NFT

  • Mystery 1-on-1 conversations

  • SolidarityVoice on Twitter Spaces

Useful links

  • Pitchdeck

  • Initiatives

Preliminary program

19 May - Reframing our mission and brand

26 May - Defining what needs to be built and in what order

2 June - Storytelling

9 June - Tokenomics

16 June - TBD

23 June - How we will measure if we are achieving our goals

30 June - Preparing for EthCC

7 July - TBD

14 July - TBD

Event.title: In conversation with Lisa Tan - author of THE book on Token Economics
Event.descriptionHtml:
We are very excited to have Lisa Tan to dive together into a conversation on Token Economics.

We will run this session as a discussion and q&a session with the participants. Please post your questions here

Lisa is an esteemed economics researcher and published her research-based book, Economics and Math of Token Engineering and DeFi, the first textbook created on Token Engineering. You can read more about her work on the economics of tokenisation at www.economicsdesign.com.
Event.descriptionText:
We are very excited to have Lisa Tan to dive together into a conversation on
Token Economics.

We will run this session as a discussion and q&a session with the participants.
Please post your questions here
[https://app.sli.do/event/krgWGzGdbzDHyRzqrM3X4H]

Lisa is an esteemed economics researcher and published her research-based book,
Economics and Math of Token Engineering and DeFi, the first textbook created on
Token Engineering. You can read more about her work on the economics of
tokenisation at www.economicsdesign.com [http://www.economicsdesign.com].

Event.title: Teatime
Event.descriptionHtml:
We're entering a new phase of our Kernel experience. So many people we'd like to keep in touch with, and so many horizontal conversations flowing.

Every Monday, the Cuppa crowd have been getting together to just catch up. No agenda, no topic, really just catching up with each other while sippin' something.

KB5 has sparked so many meaningful relationships, and those meanings extend beyond our projects and common explorations. So we'd like to extend our invitation to this space, just a place for us to keep in touch.

(Joining teatime is also the entry point to collaborating in Cuppa, and gives you access to our private forum where we riff on different ideas - think async juntos with a focus on someone's specific project idea.)

More teatimes will be scheduled in the future, on a recurring weekly or bi-weekly basis. We're just in the middle of rescheduling now to make it convenient to everyone, no matter where they are on this little rock we share. So for now, I'll just share this one for an upcoming Monday to let you all know you're welcome.

It's scheduled for 2 hours, but feel free to pop in or out anytime.

Hope to see you again :)

Event.title: ChefDAO - Decentralized online Kernel Meal
Event.descriptionHtml:
Whether you prefer Proof-of-Steak or Proof-of-Veggie, let's remove borders and share an online meal!

PST 11:00 Brunch

EDT 14:00 Lunch

CET 19:00 Dinner

Tips:

Your meal needs to be ready and cutlery provided before the call start to free your mind from cooks timer, and missing knife!

The secret for not being frustrated for what others are eating is to prepare your preferred meal! 😂

Find the best place for your computer on the table, lightly raised at your level. We are your guests!

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel - Summer of Love Edition
Event.descriptionHtml:
In which we gather to build open infrastructure for communities of care.

Playing together we explore, discuss, and experiment with some technical patterns intended to support infinite games. What kind of tools to we want to work with to create peer learning environments, and how do we want to organize around both their making and use?

These quest(ion)s and more await you. To access the notes, first:

Make a wallet here: https://staging.wallet.kernel.community/register

Unprofile yourself here: https://staging.unprofile.kernel.community/

Notes here: https://staging.adventures.kernel.community/view/kbk

Event.title: IRL Seed Phrase Security - a critical missing link to self-sovereignty
Event.descriptionHtml:
Every time you set up a wallet, the final instruction is "write down this seed phrase somewhere offline and keep it safe..." But that step is literally impossible! What do you do - safe deposit box, metal seed, hide a scrap of paper in a book? Does that scale to billions of users each with multiple wallets?

Safe IRL seed phrase storage is a critical missing link in self-sovereignty and adoption. Without it people will never feel comfortable entrusting large amounts of funds to wallets.

Let's discuss whether this is a problem, how we see different groups trying to solve it, and whether or not they are on the right track.

Event.title: Build the Playground - a place for kernel adventures to thrive!
Event.descriptionHtml:
Session 1 - User understanding - how was your experiences when carrying out your Kernel adventures? challenges? pain points? hair on fire?

Session 2 - Synthesis - taking all the session 1 feedback and identifying the key patterns, problems.

Session 3 - Brainstorm - come up together with potential solutions to the problems we identified in session 2

Session 4 - React - sharing out early mockups of UIs that demonstrate the solutions and hear how the community responds

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel - Summer of Love Edition
Event.descriptionHtml:
In which we gather to build open infrastructure for communities of care.

Playing together we explore, discuss, and experiment with some technical patterns intended to support infinite games. What kind of tools to we want to work with to create peer learning environments, and how do we want to organize around both their making and use?

These quest(ion)s and more await you. To access the notes, first:

Make a wallet here: https://staging.wallet.kernel.community/register

Unprofile yourself here: https://staging.unprofile.kernel.community/

Notes here: https://staging.adventures.kernel.community/view/kbk

Event.title: Pitch Bingo
Event.descriptionHtml:
What to quickly improve your Gitcoin Grants page or Kernel Pitch Deck?

This is a fun 2-hour peer-review format for doing rapid iteration on pitches. We will each pitch 3+ times, each time getting very structured feedback designed to make us fix one thing at a time.

You can join to pitch, or just to hear pitches and give feedback. (Every short pitch is followed by a vote and rapid-fire questions from the audience, which helps the presenter understand what was understood.)

Salim have stuck some basic instructions into a figma board here if you want to check it out first.

You can also join #jam-perfect-pitch-practicioners to continue the conversation on slack!

Event.title: NFT Project Community Building 101 - Open Brainstorming
Event.descriptionHtml:
Let's brainstorm together on the key steps to building a community for an NFT project <3

tl;dr:

  • We are building an NFT project (see below) and need to get up to speed in community building

  • As this is a topic that's interesting for many, let's make it a collective brainstorming session on the key steps, best channels, and mistakes to avoid

  • Will facilitate the session in Miro where everyone can bring his knowledge and learn from each other <3

Context - Case Study:

We are working on an NFT project that is the world's first massive co-op multiplayer game in web3 (https://www.angrydynomiteslab.com/).

While game development and smart contract development are in full swing, we need your support in how to set up a strong and organic community.

Event.title: Kernel Principles Glass Bead Game
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for dialogic games structured around the Kernel principles. We'll likely try to play two rounds, using the next two principles: Learn the limits, then you're free and Ask better questions.

On 06/15, we will use the next two principles, which are: Money means speech and Consider your intention first.

What is a Glass Bead Game?

Well, it comes from Herman Hesse's novel of the same name. Here are some quotes which should hopefully leave you asking better questions:

"The Glass Bead Game is an act of mental synthesis through which the spiritual values of all ages are perceived as simultaneously present and vitally alive."

"The Glass Bead Game is thus a mode of playing with the total contents and values of our culture; it plays with them as, say, in the great age of the arts a painter might have played with the colors on his palette."

"There is truth. But the doctrine you desire, absolute, perfect dogma that alone provides wisdom, does not exist. Nor should you long for a perfect doctrine, my friend. Rather, you should long for the perfection of yourself. The deity is with you, not in ideas and books. Truth is lived, not taught."

And one last one from our dear friend, Magister Ludi LCC, to straighten it all out:

"On the in breath, one contemplates the nature of the playground: the self as totality of being.

On the out breath, one meditates on the nature of the player: the self as pure consciousness."

Event.title: Incentivizing conversations to heal a disconnected society
Event.descriptionHtml:
How to have authentic conversations and be open with people we just met? How might we incentivize our communities to practice civilized dialogue and search to understand each other? How can we record a conversation without losing authenticity? How might we forge a path towards reconciliation in our disconnected society? Is it possible to overcome individual and collective traumas through conversations?

The video will be recorded.
Event.descriptionText:

How can we record a conversation without losing authenticity? How might we forge a path towards reconciliation in our disconnected society? Is it possible to overcome individual and collective traumas through conversations?

The video will be recorded.

Event.title: Mindful Movement with Antonio
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for a weekly movement practice with our very own, Antonio Maia. Antonio is a professional dancer and movement aficionado, amongst other skills. Classes are scheduled to be ~90 minutes long, however do not fret if you can only spare an hour--this time is meant to serve you in a way that is healthy for you. We are grateful for you to be with us at all.

Here's a note from Antonio:

I will be hosting weekly movement and dance classes for you all! The activities will range from yoga, sweat workouts, dance improvisations, and posture techniques, and the main goal for this guild will be to aid you through your process here in kernel - it is as important to take care and listen to your body, as it is your mind.

This is aimed also at a greater research project on the benefits of physical practices on learning and working spaces.

I can't wait to get to start training with you and I want to make it clear that regardless of your experience or lack of, every single BODY is welcome and cherished within the class.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

Event.title: AMA with Humaira Khan Web3 recruiting community founder
Event.descriptionHtml:
Meet Humaira Khan founder of Walzay.

Walzay is a woman lead venture that is redesigning how we think about opportunity alignment in Web3. Walzay is building a community where Web3 professionals can seek opportunity-fit and where firms can pursue high-quality team building in Web3. Let's chat with Humaira Khan about the future of work, work marketplaces, and the challenges of hiring and seeking out meaningful opportunities in Web3.

Join Walzay Community Discord

Cohosted by Rumi and Anbessa

Event.title: Social Identity-how do we define ourselves in a brave new world
Event.descriptionHtml:
Please join Philip and Susie for an enriching and delightful conversation around social identity.  We touched on this topic during a Kernel Building Kernel convo when Philip discussed Simon's use of the term "unprofile" in building Kernel's infrastructure. To seed the conversation, we will take a lesson from Kernel's playbook, complimentary opposites in the Play of Patterns, https://www.kernel.community/en/learn/module-0/play-of-pattern

Philip--

To contemplate the full gamut of conceptualizations of human identity is to entertain seeming contradictions. Identity is both stable and unstable, concrete and malleable, alike and different, within and without, singular and multiple, individual and collective, separate and connected, whole and partial, enduring and fleeting, relative and absolute, objective and subjective, cause and effect.

Susie is a KB5 fellow who is an explorer, dreamer, builder, and community-centered designer. If you haven't been in a conversation with Susie, you are missing some remarkable insights.

Philip is new to Kernel. He works for the AKASHA Foundation on complex sociotechnological systems and has written some wonderful topics such as https://medium.com/radicalxchange/the-interpersonal-data-at-the-heart-of-all-human-digital-systems-including-markets-6316701184a9

Event.title: Purpose Driven Contracts - A Call to Collaborate
Event.descriptionHtml:
I think a lot of us have come to web3 to do good in the world, even if we're still figuring out how.

If you are still idealistic, energetic and optimistic about the world and you have the good fortune to be in the right place at the right time please join us in discussing purpose driven contracts.

Generations in the 90s who had similar aspirations for how technology would make the world a better place leave us with mistakes to learn from and blueprints to carry forward.

With the spirit of intellectual humility, kindness and open collaboration in mind, let’s empower every single person on earth to have an impact on what it is they care most about.

Event.title: a Boston KERNEL Dinner 🍀
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL Dinner in Boston.

Vivek and potentially a team from ChefDAO is happy to cook dinner if we can find a local co-host in Boston or Cambridge with a home to share.

(Could this be you? Message me if so).

Otherwise will do at a restaurant in the area. Regardless, the focus will be on sharing good food with better people.

First 10 spots are guaranteed. Will let all other RSVPs know by Friday evening. Hope to see you soon 🥘

Event.title: Launching NFT Smart Contract with Manifold
Event.descriptionHtml:
Sutra 2 of the Manifold Study Group will be a design sprint for our Manifold Smart Contract.

This video walks you through the process of launching your NFT smart contract on Manifold.

In this Sutra, we will discuss the goals, customization features and gamification of our smart contract. And of course the story and the art of our NFT. We will collaborate on this Figma board.

Also, we will decide on our best minting process and delegate a minter.

Resources will continue to be added to the Manifold Study Guide.
Event.descriptionText:
Sutra 2
[https://soundcloud.com/jah9online/groundings-part-2-to-patanjalis-8-limbs-with-broderick-rodell?in=tagan-horton-138909506/sets/jam-art-yoga&utm_source=clipboard&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=social_sharing]
of the Manifold Study Group
[https://docs.google.com/document/d/10xP7tZlEIgX2FQ-qIWZ7bCuh7C_VKcNQZuiwj-07IHk/edit?usp=sharing]
will be a design sprint for our Manifold Smart Contract.

This video [https://youtu.be/oy5TKmhKmbg] walks you through the process of
launching your NFT smart contract on Manifold.

In this Sutra, we will discuss the goals, customization features and
gamification of our smart contract. And of course the story and the art of our
NFT. We will collaborate on this Figma board
[https://www.figma.com/file/uL9MCd6AQ2m4qlV12XY2v4/Manifold-Smart-Contract-Design?node-id=0%3A1].

Also, we will decide on our best minting process and delegate a minter.

Resources will continue to be added to the Manifold Study Guide.

Event.title: Meditation with Marlon
Event.descriptionHtml:
Marlon Barrios Solano, a certified Vipassana meditation teacher, has kindly offered to host 1 hour meditation sessions once a week for the duration of our empty block.

Simply come, and we can investigate together that nature of emptiness and enjoy the harmony of silence.

You need nothing to join these sessions. No prior experience is required, nor will we promote any particular technique. We will just sit together and share some small moments before and after to set the context and help integrate our shared experiences.

Event.title: Ape Coin Case Study
Event.descriptionHtml: Yuga Labs strikes again, now they are launching ApeCoin ( https://apecoin.com/about ). ApeCoin is an ERC-20 governance and utility token used within the APE ecosystem to empower a decentralized community building at the forefront of web3. It's an interesting opportunity to deep dive and understand all the mechanism they will use and the implications it can have for all the NFT market itself.

Yuga Labs strikes again, now they are

Event.title: Cancelled - LUV Art Wellness Meet-Up
Event.descriptionHtml:
Peace and blessings,

For this week’s LUV Art Wellness Meet-up, we invite you to the LUV tea house. 

We will have tea with our friend, JO AN. She is a NFT community advisor and DAO guru. We met JO AN at the Art Hotel during ETH Denver and hung out at the Schelling Point event. 

JO AN will be a featured guests for this conversation alongside Rumi, a designer and economist from inside Kernel.  The conversation will be co-hosted by Anbessa, a podcaster from NY and Tagan, a podcaster from ATL. 

This event will offer critique to the emerging socioeconomics of NFTs, NFT current events and Gary Vee’s recent podcast on Flagarant 2 with Akaash Singh and Andrew Schulz.

For art wellness resources visit the LUV Playground.

With love,

Opera Sneaker

Event.title: Better Metaphors in Web3
Event.descriptionHtml:
Is it a wallet, a backpack, a loot bag, a portal...? As we know, web3 vernacular can be confusing and doesn't always fit with our web2 mental models.

If we want to build shared understanding + open the design space for new possibilities, language is critical.

Join Cult Leader En, Derya Karli, and Susie Kavanaugh to discuss better metaphors.

Event.title: Pitch Bingo
Event.descriptionHtml:
Hey everyone!

Join us for these 2 last workshops of Pitch bingo series!

Pitch Bingo is a fun 2-hour peer-review format for doing rapid iteration on pitches (introduced by our fellow kerneling Salim). We will each pitch 3+ times, each time getting very structured feedback designed to make us fix one thing at a time.

You can join to pitch, or just to hear pitches and give feedback. (Every short pitch is followed by a vote and rapid-fire questions from the audience, which helps the presenter understand what was understood.)

You can also join #jam-perfect-pitch-practitioners to continue the conversation on Slack!

Event.title: Gaming Guild
Event.descriptionHtml: The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel. Conceptual analysis is left for your own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision and create a better web together.
Event.descriptionText:
The OG Guild in Kernel, hosted by Paul Gadi and friends. We’ve updated and
re-formatted this longest running group and will focus on building and iterating
over many different types of games and primitives in each week of Kernel.
Conceptual analysis [https://kernel.community/en/build/games/] is left for your
own reading delight as we adventure with many wonderful builders through many
imaginary worlds in an attempt to understand how play might help us all envision
and create a better web together.

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel - Summer of Love Edition
Event.descriptionHtml:
In which we gather to build open infrastructure for communities of care.

Playing together we explore, discuss, and experiment with some technical patterns intended to support infinite games. What kind of tools to we want to work with to create peer learning environments, and how do we want to organize around both their making and use?

These quest(ion)s and more await you. To access the notes, first:

Make a wallet here: https://staging.wallet.kernel.community/register

Unprofile yourself here: https://staging.unprofile.kernel.community/

Notes here: https://staging.adventures.kernel.community/view/kbk

Playing together we explore, discuss, and experiment with some technical patterns intended to support infinite games. What kind of tools to we want to work with to create peer learning environments, and how do we want to organize around both their making and use?

These quest(ion)s and more await you. To access the notes, first:

Make a wallet here: https://staging.wallet.kernel.community/register

Unprofile yourself here: https://staging.unprofile.kernel.community/

Notes here: https://staging.adventures.kernel.community/view/kbk

Event.title: From KYC to know-your-neighbor
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Solidarity during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

We are building a citizen-led global basic income, based on a compounding web of trust and care that is created through the recording of authentic conversations between neighbors.

Context

SolidarityCard is evolving. In the beginning, we talked about a debit card for homeless and undocumented people. However, it was never intended to be exclusively for them, but for everyone.

Since we initially focused our communication around helping this population, many people misunderstood the need to record our conversations and the essential role of these recordings to provide an alternative to KYC. Furthermore, convincing governments to try this alternative and being able to issue debit cards to people without official documents and proof-of-address is going to take some time.

Liberating ourselves from poverty is not simply a financial matter, it is also about liberating our minds from the idea that poverty and inequality are acceptable conditions in our society. We have built all our social structures based on the narrative that humans are valuable for what they produce and that being successful means owning more than the others with which we are in competition. But narratives can be rewritten and societies can be transformed.

Ultimately, our goal is neither a debit card, nor a web of trust, not even a basic income, but social cohesion and long-term thinking at a global scale.

Initiatives

After tons of illuminating exchanges with your brilliant minds we now think that we can start building everything else before the card. If we break apart the different blocks in a well thought out manner, they can start creating value for all our Web3 projects and also for society at large.

These are some of the initiatives we think could be useful for this stage:

  • Activator App

  • Identity Certificate NFT

  • Mystery 1-on-1 conversations

  • SolidarityVoice on Twitter Spaces

Useful links

  • Pitchdeck

  • Initiatives

Preliminary program

19 May - Reframing our mission and brand

26 May - Defining what needs to be built and in what order

2 June - Storytelling

9 June - Tokenomics

16 June - TBD

23 June - How we will measure if we are achieving our goals

30 June - Preparing for EthCC

7 July - TBD

14 July - TBD
