Event.title: Mapping the body-mind journey - Part 2
Event.descriptionHtml:
Part 2: Mapping the body-mind journey:

Engaging your inner-self through Improv (body-mind-object) practice

You are invited to experiment with performing art processes, using objects and imagination to create experiences as a way to address complexity:

“Experiences have the potential to integrate “hard” and “soft” data present in any situation. They use exactly this potential of constructing an integrated understanding of a complex - multileveled - reality that experiential knowing offers us, as it combines various ways of relating us with the world such as the mindful, the sensory, the embodied and the emotional.” Gregory Bateson, An Ecology of Mind

To work with our imagination, we need to engage our inner-self: 

“To realize a dream and create a new reality, we need to be in touch with our emotions, ‘want’ and motivation and thus with our inner self”. Philosopher Ernst Bloch links the intimate process and the impulse that leads to creative action: “Connecting to our intimate world mobilizes our creativity and our imagination. Free thoughts are floating inside us which get turned into actions and impulses are energy to convert into actions these thoughts that live inside us as a result of our experiences”. (...) One cannot engage one’s inner self without engaging one’s subjectivity. In addition, the philosopher highlights the value of myths, folk stories, and tales as a qualitative and symbolic forms of our historical conscience. The artist refers to the above when creating new signifiers and opening up the possibility for new worlds.”  Bloch, J.; Verchère, C. How Art Places Climate Change at the Heart of Technological Innovation. J. Open Innov. Technol. Mark. Complex. 2019, 5, 93. https://doi.org/10.3390/joitmc5040093

  

Please, bring:

  • a glass of water,

  • a toilet paper roll,

  • a pen,

  • a fruit!

As an example, we propose to act/move/make in order to explore performative metabolism in relation to Dynamic Energy Budget Adventure.

Video from SatoriD/Imaginarium gathering/Omega Working Group @TEC Working Group)

Event.title: In forming Money We Make Our World
Event.descriptionHtml:
We welcome Michael Linton and Gail Franklin to talk about money as information.

Michael has been working on Open Money for a long time: https://openmoney.org/top/omanifesto.html

"Money is just information, a way we measure what we trade, nothing of value in itself. And we can make it ourselves, to work as a complement to conventional money. Just a matter of design."

Event.title: Block 7 Interviews
Event.descriptionHtml:
Dear Guides,

We will be conducting several rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from July 12 - Aug 12.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB7 fellows for each round.

  • Topics for all upcoming Interview Juntos:

    • July 12, Tuesday: Hospitality, Thanksgiving

    • July 12, Tuesday (6PM - 8PM ET): Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • July 14, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • July 15, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    • July 18, Monday: Censorship Resistance, Learn

    • July 20, Wednesday: Giving, Scalability

    • July 21, Thursday: Remember, Lock it Open

    • July 28, Thursday: Conversation, Money Talks

    • July 29, Friday: Finding Lost Paradises, Prosocial Value

    • Aug 1, Monday: The Gift, The Infinite Game

    • Aug 2, Tuesday: Transform, Consensus

    • Aug 3, Wednesday: Meaning, Value

    • Aug 4, Thursday: Intention, Freedom

    • Aug 5, Friday: Listening & Stories, Incentives

    • Aug 8, Monday: Learn how to learn, Censorship Resistance

    • Aug 9, Tuesday: Unbounded Search, The People's Narrative

    • Aug 10, Wednesday: Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • Aug 11, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • Aug 12, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

    Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

Event.title: Proper Verbs - Making Ownership Radically Weird
Event.descriptionHtml:
We'll host Glen Weyl and friends for a discussion about ownership and property.

"Ethereum (and its standards) should 'get weird', and shouldn’t be opinionated about property laws: those should be programmable or configurable."

In particular, we have in mind ongoing discussions about signatures, economies, individual autonomy and mutual aid, verbs over nouns, and identity-as-immanent-in-relationships-as-immanent-in-information-exchange (not as a thing-to-hang-other-things-off).

It promises to be one for the books.

Event.title: KERNEL Storytime
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL Storytime is a weekly gathering in the Empty Block where everyone is invited to share and listen to stories from the KERNEL family. We believe that stories can deepen our understanding of ourselves, each other, and the world around us. We think stories should be told and shared by many diverse voices. We hope Storytime will foster deep social bonds and greater understanding through human connection.  

The genesis of Storytime evolved from wanting more opportunities for cross-pollination and discovery among Blocks. We’re inspired by the potential of storytelling in our community, where your stories become tools to better understand the present and radically reimagine possible futures. We envision Storytime as a catalyst to explore ideas and experiment with alternative ways of doing and being collectively, as a catalyst to create communities of care. 

As Storytime is a new initiative, we have no set flow or format to share just yet. We’re embracing the ethos of the Empty Block: experimentation, reflection, and feedback. Our intention is to create a nurturing environment. One that feels healthy, warm, welcoming, and supportive. Feel free to reach out with any questions or ideas. 

Susie and Aliya are excited to go on this journey with all of you! Join us for one session or multiple sessions. Please bring yourself, an open mind and open heart. For on-going communications, join us in the Slack channel #kernel-storytime.

Please note these sessions will not be recorded. We hope to soon share asynchronous ways of participating, stay tuned!

Event.title: Yoga with Cheryl
Event.descriptionHtml:
Yoga session with KERNEL community led by Cheryl Davison.

This class uses intentional movement and breathwork to help cleanse the body, calm the mind, build body awareness and strength, and lengthen muscles.

Sometimes, we mix in learnings from the Melt Method and from the KERNEL syllabus.

Event.title: Yoga with Cheryl
Event.descriptionHtml:
Yoga session with KERNEL community led by Cheryl Davison.

This class uses intentional movement and breathwork to help cleanse the body, calm the mind, build body awareness and strength, and lengthen muscles.

Sometimes, we mix in learnings from the Melt Method and from the KERNEL syllabus.

Event.title: KERNEL Storytime
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL Storytime is a weekly gathering in the Empty Block where everyone is invited to share and listen to stories from the KERNEL family. We believe that stories can deepen our understanding of ourselves, each other, and the world around us. We think stories should be told and shared by many diverse voices. We hope Storytime will foster deep social bonds and greater understanding through human connection.  

The genesis of Storytime evolved from wanting more opportunities for cross-pollination and discovery among Blocks. We’re inspired by the potential of storytelling in our community, where your stories become tools to better understand the present and radically reimagine possible futures. We envision Storytime as a catalyst to explore ideas and experiment with alternative ways of doing and being collectively, as a catalyst to create communities of care. 

As Storytime is a new initiative, we have no set flow or format to share just yet. We’re embracing the ethos of the Empty Block: experimentation, reflection, and feedback. Our intention is to create a nurturing environment. One that feels healthy, warm, welcoming, and supportive. Feel free to reach out with any questions or ideas. 

Susie and Aliya are excited to go on this journey with all of you! Join us for one session or multiple sessions. Please bring yourself, an open mind and open heart. For on-going communications, join us in the Slack channel #kernel-storytime.

Please note these sessions will not be recorded. We hope to soon share asynchronous ways of participating, stay tuned!

Event.title: Literary NFTs and DAOs
Event.descriptionHtml:
Peace and blessings KERNELers. On March 4th, I hosted the first NFT Creative Sovereignty Research Group for the community. Since then, we have compiled a growing study guide on Manifold.xyz and published a popcast. 

Members of the group have expressed interest in exploring NFT tools on other protocols. Tomorrow, join one of the group members Sparrow Read on Twitter Spaces. Sparrow is the founder of The Platform, a NFT marketplace being built on the Palm Protocol. The Platform is being built as a literary NFT publisher and DAO. 

Join us on Twitter spaces for a live Q&A on literary NFTs & DAOs.

Event.title: From hopeless human to greenpilled regen
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Activape during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

Activape is an onboarding tool to transform hopeless humans into greenpilled regens acting together for public goods.

Humanity is facing the greatest crisis of its short existence, and yet most humans are either hopeless, traumatized, or in denial, while those that would like to do something often feel impotent and alone within a system that’s built to resist change.

Web3 has the potential to become a schelling point for the hopeful, but the barriers to entry are still too high. Many get lost in the complexity and end up abandoning the adventure.

Today’s ImpactDAOs and NGOs face common challenges

  • Attract engaged and diverse contributors

  • Improve the time to first meaningful contribution and first payment

  • Empower contributors to act autonomously

Today’s citizens have common needs

  • Find your causes and your people

  • Get rewarded for your positive impact

  • Start acting today for what you care about

Useful documents

  • Brainstorming

  • Pitchdeck

Preliminary program

  1. Why? OKRs? KPIs?

  2. TBD

  3. TBD

  4. Tokenomics? Activist Ikigai NFTs? $ACTIV token? Wen???

  5. TBD

  6. TBD

  7. Preparing for EthCC

  8. TBD

  9. TBD

Event.title: Resiliency in Web3 times - Pizza in Berkeley
Event.location: IRL Zachary's Pizza 1853 Solano Ave, Berkeley, CA 94707
Event.descriptionHtml: Join Kernel fellows and other web3 friends to share how we manage the promise and turbulence of our current times. The bear market for crypto and the hacks of large funds like Harmony challenge our views of jobs, shared dreams, purpose and trust. What are our next steps? Let's talk about how we are managing these stressful times. Hint - Andy and Charles Eisenstein suggest we 'change the question'.
Event.descriptionText: Join Kernel fellows and other web3 friends to share how we manage the promise and turbulence of our current times.  The bear market for crypto and the hacks of large funds like Harmony challenge our views of jobs, shared dreams, purpose and trust.  What are our next steps? Let's talk about how we are managing these stressful times.  Hint - Andy and Charles Eisenstein suggest we 'change the question'.

Event.title: Censorship Resistance
Event.descriptionHtml:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto!

In this junto, we'll talk about Censorship Resistance. You will be in a Zoom chat alongside 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or Steward.

Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community.

If you may serendipitously miss your interview, please do not fret and take a deep breath! You'll be able to reschedule it, we promise
Event.descriptionText:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto!

In this junto, we'll talk about Censorship Resistance
[https://www.kernel.community/en/learn/module-6/censorship-resistance]. You will
be in a Zoom chat alongside 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or
Steward.

Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community [hello@kernel.community].

If you may serendipitously miss your interview, please do not fret and take a
deep breath! You'll be able to reschedule it, we promise

Event.title: KERNEL Storytime
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL Storytime is a weekly gathering in the Empty Block where everyone is invited to share and listen to stories from the KERNEL family. We believe that stories can deepen our understanding of ourselves, each other, and the world around us. We think stories should be told and shared by many diverse voices. We hope Storytime will foster deep social bonds and greater understanding through human connection.  

The genesis of Storytime evolved from wanting more opportunities for cross-pollination and discovery among Blocks. We’re inspired by the potential of storytelling in our community, where your stories become tools to better understand the present and radically reimagine possible futures. We envision Storytime as a catalyst to explore ideas and experiment with alternative ways of doing and being collectively, as a catalyst to create communities of care. 

As Storytime is a new initiative, we have no set flow or format to share just yet. We’re embracing the ethos of the Empty Block: experimentation, reflection, and feedback. Our intention is to create a nurturing environment. One that feels healthy, warm, welcoming, and supportive. Feel free to reach out with any questions or ideas. 

Susie and Aliya are excited to go on this journey with all of you! Join us for one session or multiple sessions. Please bring yourself, an open mind and open heart. For on-going communications, join us in the Slack channel #kernel-storytime.

Please note these sessions will not be recorded. We hope to soon share asynchronous ways of participating, stay tuned!

Event.title: From hopeless human to greenpilled regen
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Activape during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

Activape is an onboarding tool to transform hopeless humans into greenpilled regens acting together for public goods.

Humanity is facing the greatest crisis of its short existence, and yet most humans are either hopeless, traumatized, or in denial, while those that would like to do something often feel impotent and alone within a system that’s built to resist change.

Web3 has the potential to become a schelling point for the hopeful, but the barriers to entry are still too high. Many get lost in the complexity and end up abandoning the adventure.

Today’s ImpactDAOs and NGOs face common challenges

  • Attract engaged and diverse contributors

  • Improve the time to first meaningful contribution and first payment

  • Empower contributors to act autonomously

Today’s citizens have common needs

  • Find your causes and your people

  • Get rewarded for your positive impact

  • Start acting today for what you care about

Useful documents

  • Brainstorming

  • Pitchdeck

Preliminary program

  1. Why? OKRs? KPIs?

  2. TBD

  3. TBD

  4. Tokenomics? Activist Ikigai NFTs? $ACTIV token? Wen???

  5. TBD

  6. TBD

  7. Preparing for EthCC

  8. TBD

  9. TBD

Event.title: From KYC to know-your-neighbor
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Solidarity during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

We are building a citizen-led global basic income, based on a compounding web of trust and care that is created through the recording of authentic conversations between neighbors.

Context

SolidarityCard is evolving. In the beginning, we talked about a debit card for homeless and undocumented people. However, it was never intended to be exclusively for them, but for everyone.

Since we initially focused our communication around helping this population, many people misunderstood the need to record our conversations and the essential role of these recordings to provide an alternative to KYC. Furthermore, convincing governments to try this alternative and being able to issue debit cards to people without official documents and proof-of-address is going to take some time.

Liberating ourselves from poverty is not simply a financial matter, it is also about liberating our minds from the idea that poverty and inequality are acceptable conditions in our society. We have built all our social structures based on the narrative that humans are valuable for what they produce and that being successful means owning more than the others with which we are in competition. But narratives can be rewritten and societies can be transformed.

Ultimately, our goal is neither a debit card, nor a web of trust, not even a basic income, but social cohesion and long-term thinking at a global scale.

Initiatives

After tons of illuminating exchanges with your brilliant minds we now think that we can start building everything else before the card. If we break apart the different blocks in a well thought out manner, they can start creating value for all our Web3 projects and also for society at large.

These are some of the initiatives we think could be useful for this stage:

  • Activator App

  • Identity Certificate NFT

  • Mystery 1-on-1 conversations

  • SolidarityVoice on Twitter Spaces

Useful links

  • Pitchdeck

  • Initiatives

Preliminary program

19 May - Reframing our mission and brand

26 May - Defining what needs to be built and in what order

2 June - Storytelling

9 June - Tokenomics

16 June - TBD

23 June - How we will measure if we are achieving our goals

30 June - Preparing for EthCC

7 July - TBD

14 July - TBD

Event.title: From KYC to know-your-neighbor
Event.descriptionHtml:
A series of conversations to build Solidarity during the summer of love.

This is an invitation to contribute.

We are building a citizen-led global basic income, based on a compounding web of trust and care that is created through the recording of authentic conversations between neighbors.

Context

SolidarityCard is evolving. In the beginning, we talked about a debit card for homeless and undocumented people. However, it was never intended to be exclusively for them, but for everyone.

Since we initially focused our communication around helping this population, many people misunderstood the need to record our conversations and the essential role of these recordings to provide an alternative to KYC. Furthermore, convincing governments to try this alternative and being able to issue debit cards to people without official documents and proof-of-address is going to take some time.

Liberating ourselves from poverty is not simply a financial matter, it is also about liberating our minds from the idea that poverty and inequality are acceptable conditions in our society. We have built all our social structures based on the narrative that humans are valuable for what they produce and that being successful means owning more than the others with which we are in competition. But narratives can be rewritten and societies can be transformed.

Ultimately, our goal is neither a debit card, nor a web of trust, not even a basic income, but social cohesion and long-term thinking at a global scale.

Initiatives

After tons of illuminating exchanges with your brilliant minds we now think that we can start building everything else before the card. If we break apart the different blocks in a well thought out manner, they can start creating value for all our Web3 projects and also for society at large.

These are some of the initiatives we think could be useful for this stage:

  • Activator App

  • Identity Certificate NFT

  • Mystery 1-on-1 conversations

  • SolidarityVoice on Twitter Spaces

Useful links

  • Pitchdeck

  • Initiatives

Preliminary program

19 May - Reframing our mission and brand

26 May - Defining what needs to be built and in what order

2 June - Storytelling

9 June - Tokenomics

16 June - TBD

23 June - How we will measure if we are achieving our goals

30 June - Preparing for EthCC

7 July - TBD

14 July - TBD

Event.title: KERNEL Storytime
Event.descriptionHtml:
KERNEL Storytime is a weekly gathering in the Empty Block where everyone is invited to share and listen to stories from the KERNEL family. We believe that stories can deepen our understanding of ourselves, each other, and the world around us. We think stories should be told and shared by many diverse voices. We hope Storytime will foster deep social bonds and greater understanding through human connection.  

The genesis of Storytime evolved from wanting more opportunities for cross-pollination and discovery among Blocks. We’re inspired by the potential of storytelling in our community, where your stories become tools to better understand the present and radically reimagine possible futures. We envision Storytime as a catalyst to explore ideas and experiment with alternative ways of doing and being collectively, as a catalyst to create communities of care. 

As Storytime is a new initiative, we have no set flow or format to share just yet. We’re embracing the ethos of the Empty Block: experimentation, reflection, and feedback. Our intention is to create a nurturing environment. One that feels healthy, warm, welcoming, and supportive. Feel free to reach out with any questions or ideas. 

Susie and Aliya are excited to go on this journey with all of you! Join us for one session or multiple sessions. Please bring yourself, an open mind and open heart. For on-going communications, join us in the Slack channel #kernel-storytime.

Please note these sessions will not be recorded. We hope to soon share asynchronous ways of participating, stay tuned!

Event.title: Mindful Movement with Antonio
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for a weekly movement practice with our very own, Antonio Maia. Antonio is a professional dancer and movement aficionado, amongst other skills. Classes are scheduled to be ~90 minutes long, however do not fret if you can only spare an hour--this time is meant to serve you in a way that is healthy for you. We are grateful for you to be with us at all.

Here's a note from Antonio:

I will be hosting weekly movement and dance classes for you all! The activities will range from yoga, sweat workouts, dance improvisations, and posture techniques, and the main goal for this guild will be to aid you through your process here in kernel - it is as important to take care and listen to your body, as it is your mind.

This is aimed also at a greater research project on the benefits of physical practices on learning and working spaces.

I can't wait to get to start training with you and I want to make it clear that regardless of your experience or lack of, every single BODY is welcome and cherished within the class.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

Event.title: Block 7 Interviews
Event.descriptionHtml:
Dear Guides,

We will be conducting several rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from July 12 - Aug 12.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB7 fellows for each round.

  • Topics for all upcoming Interview Juntos:

    • July 12, Tuesday: Hospitality, Thanksgiving

    • July 12, Tuesday (6PM - 8PM ET): Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • July 14, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • July 15, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    • July 18, Monday: Censorship Resistance, Learn

    • July 20, Wednesday: Giving, Scalability

    • July 21, Thursday: Remember, Lock it Open

    • July 28, Thursday: Conversation, Money Talks

    • July 29, Friday: Finding Lost Paradises, Prosocial Value

    • Aug 1, Monday: The Gift, The Infinite Game

    • Aug 2, Tuesday: Transform, Consensus

    • Aug 3, Wednesday: Meaning, Value

    • Aug 4, Thursday: Intention, Freedom

    • Aug 5, Friday: Listening & Stories, Incentives

    • Aug 8, Monday: Learn how to learn, Censorship Resistance

    • Aug 9, Tuesday: Unbounded Search, The People's Narrative

    • Aug 10, Wednesday: Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • Aug 11, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • Aug 12, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

    Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

These practices are here to connect you on a deeper level with the body that you live in, and I am more than open to hear comments, feedbacks, and engage on 1:1 sessions regarding the classes.

Event.title: Mindfulness and LUV with Gloria Kimbwala
Event.descriptionHtml:
Reactions to the failure of TerraUST, highlights our need for Mental Health conversations in Web 3. It may be a saving grace, to our society plagued with an addiction to money and consumption.

What causes the emotional impact the usage of money has over our lives? How can we lead with the love for humanity?

Mindfulness is a gift to humanity. It is the act of being aware of the present.

  • Where we are

  • What we are doing

Let’s talk about it together. Ironically, the journey to self-love can’t be done alone. We all need a community to support us.

Event.title: Stablecoins Impact on NFTs
Event.descriptionHtml:
In 2021, we saw the explosion of NFTs bring crypto to life. Yet, we have barely scratched the surface of the potential of NFTs. How do NFTs and stablecoins, crypto’s killer app, impact each other?

As of today, the total stablecoin market cap is $180B. Nearly 75% of which are home to Ethereum. The Terra Ecosystem was pulling away from this market until recent events. Terra's stable coin lost its peg and created a spiral of events for its community of "LUNAtics."

Read the blog, Stablecoins Impact on NFTs: MakerDAO (DAI) vs Terra (UST) Algorithm for:

  • Overview of Stablecoins

  • Stablecoins Impact on NFTs

  • DAI vs. UST: Algorithmic Stablecoins

  • How Terra’s Decline Impacts Its NFT Ecosystem

Event.title: Signature Economies
Event.descriptionHtml:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto!
In this one, we'll talk about Signature Economies. Please read it before you come to the conversation.
For the majority of the hour, you will be in a zoom breakout alongside with 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or, Steward. It is intended to be a space to meet interesting others, explore the ideas in the above article, and mostly — to have fun while getting to know KERNEL. More than anything, please enjoy.
Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community
If you miss your interview, please do not fret! You’ll be able to reschedule it, we promise.

Event.title: Kernel SF - Rooftop summer barbecue
Event.descriptionHtml: Hey everyone, let's get Kernel fellows in the SF Bay Area together for a rooftop barbecue. I will host you and prepare the food ( 50 Jones St ). Please just bring any drinks of choice (BYOB) and interesting topics for conversations!
Event.descriptionText: Hey everyone, let's get Kernel fellows in the SF Bay Area together for a rooftop barbecue. I will host you and prepare the food ( 50 Jones St ). Please just bring any drinks of choice (BYOB) and interesting topics for conversations!

Event.title: Convivial KERNEL - Fireside Explorations
Event.descriptionHtml:
During KERNEL's empty block, we will host 3 firesides around topics typically left uncovered in Web3 and will welcome back fellows from past KERNEL blocks, KERNEL mentors,

We expect a small but incredible group from around KERNEL to join us for the three sessions, in a book club style setting. We will prioritize ways the group gets to know each other alongside spending time in dialogue together.

  • (5/26) Conversation: "We must converse in a manner that both engenders a force of healing and reflects the cultural currency of relationality and reciprocity." How may web3 be a force for healthier conversational space? Why might this be at the heart of our shared exploration towards a better web? We draw upon indigenous teachings to explore this topic in depth.

  • (6/16) Educational Webs: The current search for new educational funnels must be reversed into the search for their institutional inverse: educational webs which heighten the opportunity for each one to transform each moment of living into one of learning, sharing, and caring amongst peers. Ivan Illich helps us explore, together.

  • (7/7): *Local, Resilient* Communities of Care: Can we create a culture where I am wealthy by virtue of what I care for, rather than what I control? Can we create environments where what I hold is made valuable because of the community to which it binds me?

These topics are often under-covered during KERNEL Blocks, but get more squarely to the promise we see possible in web3 with the products and communal spaces we build.

We hope to spend time with an incredible group of artists, creatives, technologists, and humans in an intimate, enjoyable environment focused both on the content and the ways the group may better know one another.

Event.title: Hospitality
Event.descriptionHtml:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto! In this one, we'll talk about Hospitality. You will be in a Zoom chat alongside 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or Steward.

Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community.

If you may serendipitously miss your interview, please do not fret and take a deep breath! You'll be able to reschedule it, we promise.

Event.title: Block 7 Interviews
Event.descriptionHtml:
Dear Guides,

We will be conducting several rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from July 12 - Aug 12.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB7 fellows for each round.

  • Topics for all upcoming Interview Juntos:

    • July 12, Tuesday: Hospitality, Thanksgiving

    • July 12, Tuesday (6PM - 8PM ET): Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • July 14, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • July 15, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    • July 18, Monday: Censorship Resistance, Learn

    • July 20, Wednesday: Giving, Scalability

    • July 21, Thursday: Remember, Lock it Open

    • July 28, Thursday: Conversation, Money Talks

    • July 29, Friday: Finding Lost Paradises, Prosocial Value

    • Aug 1, Monday: The Gift, The Infinite Game

    • Aug 2, Tuesday: Transform, Consensus

    • Aug 3, Wednesday: Meaning, Value

    • Aug 4, Thursday: Intention, Freedom

    • Aug 5, Friday: Listening & Stories, Incentives

    • Aug 8, Monday: Learn how to learn, Censorship Resistance

    • Aug 9, Tuesday: Unbounded Search, The People's Narrative

    • Aug 10, Wednesday: Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • Aug 11, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • Aug 12, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

    Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

Event.title: Scalability
Event.descriptionHtml:
Greetings & Welcome to Your First KERNEL Junto!
In this one, we'll talk about Scalability. Please read it before you come to the conversation.
For the majority of the hour, you will be in a zoom breakout alongside with 3-4 potential fellows and one KERNEL Guide or, Steward. It is intended to be a space to meet interesting others, explore the ideas in the above article, and mostly — to have fun while getting to know KERNEL. More than anything, please enjoy.
Questions? Write us at hello@kernel.community
If you miss your interview, please do not fret! You’ll be able to reschedule it, we promise.

Event.title: Block 7 Interviews
Event.descriptionHtml:
Dear Guides,

We will be conducting several rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from July 12 - Aug 12.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB7 fellows for each round.

  • Topics for all upcoming Interview Juntos:

    • July 12, Tuesday: Hospitality, Thanksgiving

    • July 12, Tuesday (6PM - 8PM ET): Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • July 14, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • July 15, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    • July 18, Monday: Censorship Resistance, Learn

    • July 20, Wednesday: Giving, Scalability

    • July 21, Thursday: Remember, Lock it Open

    • July 28, Thursday: Conversation, Money Talks

    • July 29, Friday: Finding Lost Paradises, Prosocial Value

    • Aug 1, Monday: The Gift, The Infinite Game

    • Aug 2, Tuesday: Transform, Consensus

    • Aug 3, Wednesday: Meaning, Value

    • Aug 4, Thursday: Intention, Freedom

    • Aug 5, Friday: Listening & Stories, Incentives

    • Aug 8, Monday: Learn how to learn, Censorship Resistance

    • Aug 9, Tuesday: Unbounded Search, The People's Narrative

    • Aug 10, Wednesday: Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • Aug 11, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • Aug 12, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

    Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.

Event.title: Sunset Dinner in Paris
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us for a small gathering to enjoy home cooked food, celebrate a KERNEL birthday, and admire the setting of the sun together.

We will update the event if we find a larger space and can invite more friends.

We will email out the address on July 23rd.

With Love,

Your Kernel Stewards

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB7 fellows for each round.

    • July 12, Tuesday (6PM - 8PM ET): Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • July 14, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • July 15, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    • July 18, Monday: Censorship Resistance, Learn

    • July 20, Wednesday: Giving, Scalability

    • July 21, Thursday: Remember, Lock it Open

    • July 28, Thursday: Conversation, Money Talks

    • July 29, Friday: Finding Lost Paradises, Prosocial Value

    • Aug 1, Monday: The Gift, The Infinite Game

    • Aug 2, Tuesday: Transform, Consensus

    • Aug 5, Friday: Listening & Stories, Incentives

    • Aug 10, Wednesday: Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • Aug 11, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • Aug 12, Friday: Incentives, Listening

Event.title: Tokenomics Study Group KB6 SPECIAL EDITION RETROSPECTIVE
Event.descriptionHtml:
In this special Empty Block edition of TSG, we will look back on the protocols we discussed in previous sessions, see how they have faired through the recent crash, and reexamine our assumptions with the sober eyes of the bear market. We will start with TSG favorite Arweave and touch on Panvala and Olympus if we have time.

For background reading, Figma boards, and any links to more recent developments in these protocols, check the #guild-token-communities channel.

Event.title: Psychoanalysis and the Chinese Diaspora
Event.descriptionHtml: Please join us for a formal conversation on psychoanalysis and its 20th and 21st century practices as it pertains to Chinese immigrants and Chinese diasporic subjects. Topics will include: Chinese melancholia and melodrama, etiological compromises for recent history, the history of transcultural psychoanalysis in the Sinophone Pacific, and deflection and attacks on linking.

Event.title: KB7 GUILD - Regeneration
Event.descriptionHtml:
What might a regenerative economy look like? How can we most gracefully cultivate a thriving coexistence for all life on Earth?  Where might we find or create credible paths towards healthy, prosocial futures?

Perhaps the most difficult problem in software is choosing what to build. While humanity’s technical capabilities are more powerful than ever, this 3 part series is intended to help us create more wholesome economic environments in which we can live well together. We’ll find our breath, connect, play, and explore via a facilitated, interactive workshop series, iterating through small breakout sessions and visual communication.

Participants will discover what regeneration means to the group, listen and identify emergent patterns and systems, and reflect upon our personal agency. These events will be recorded, we’ll be announcing guest speakers, and there will be opportunities to offer your own reflections through scheduled 1:1 interviews along the way.

Preparation

Familiarize yourself with pre-readings here. This is an interactive and participatory experience. You’ll be in small breakouts and be expected to collaborate using a digital whiteboard. Please plan to join with a laptop or desktop and choose a suitable location to participate.

Event.title: KB7 Junto — Identity Jam
Event.descriptionHtml:
Human identity is essential to sense-making and cooperation and so then to the fundamental processes of human life. It is complex in its operations and so in its descriptions; it means different things to different people in different contexts.

What are the different ways to think about human identity? Who are you? How do we connect with each other? What happens when digital technologies are in the mix? What happens when we are all assemblages of the mental, the physical, and the digital? How might we want this to work out? How do we definitely not want this to work out?! After all, no other facet of information technology smashes into the human condition in quite the same way.

Come join a Junto lead by Philip Sheldrake and Jason Mah. Philip has been working in the dweb for eight years, four with the AKASHA Foundation during which time he focused his research on the digital mediation and augmentation of human identity. Jason Mah is a KB5 Fellow / KB7 Guide looking to expand his understanding of identity and how it impacts the growth and development of individuals and communities.

Event.title: KB7 GUILD - Open Data
Event.descriptionHtml:
The framing question for this guild is: can open data facilitate friendship?

In order to begin exploring the space of better questions this frame creates, we’ll study agalmics, dynamic knowledge repositories, networked knowledge artifacts, and interdependent, reciprocal transfer mechanisms. We’ll consider first the history of these terms and then dive into their modern and practical application as a part of the decentralized web, epitomized by IPFS, The Graph, Arweave, Ocean Protocol and many others.

Preparation

You can begin preparing for this guild by reading the content here, which we will cover quite quickly in the first session before going into a group discussion.

After this scene-setting, we will get more practical with some help from The Graph, IPFS and some other friends.

After this scene-setting, we will get more practical with some help from The Graph, IPFS and some other friends.

Event.title: KB7 GUILD - Open Data
Event.descriptionHtml:
The framing question for this guild is: can open data facilitate friendship?

In order to begin exploring the space of better questions this frame creates, we’ll study agalmics, dynamic knowledge repositories, networked knowledge artifacts, and interdependent, reciprocal transfer mechanisms. We’ll consider first the history of these terms and then dive into their modern and practical application as a part of the decentralized web, epitomized by IPFS, The Graph, Arweave, Ocean Protocol and many others.

Preparation

You can begin preparing for this guild by reading the content here, which we will cover quite quickly in the first session before going into a group discussion.

After this scene-setting, we will get more practical with some help from The Graph, IPFS and some other friends.

Event.title: KB7 GUILD - DAOs and Dragons
Event.descriptionHtml:
Adventure across unknown, time-shifted collaborative landscapes with Kei and Isaac. We’ll introduce you to DAOs, give you some of their prehistory, find out what kind of work you may be doing in this brave new world, and then deploy our own DAO.

We’ll use the remaining sessions to provide prompts in the style of Dungeons & Dragons to take us all through various scenarios with the goal of documenting different pattern languages for DAOs made up of different numbers of people, motivated by different goals, and attacked by different kinds of adversaries.

The work we do will get added to zodia.wiki if it forms into applicable patterns that could serve the wider community.

Preparation

Read through the content here to familiarise yourself with the general direction we'll be heading in. Consider looking over zodiac.wiki and also - if you're really keen - play around with DAOhaus. Ping us in the #guild-daos channel in slack if you need some test ETH or tokens for this kind of learning play.

Event.title: Kernel Building Kernel
Event.descriptionHtml:
Join us to keep building Kernel services: a family of focused web apps written in React.

This is the infrastructure that will serve Kernel. It is being created with love and care by Simon, Andy, Anthony, Malay, Masha, Salim, Rory and many others.

You can find out more about what each part is intended to do here.

Come for the light-hearted vision, stay for the excellence...

Event.title: KB7 GUILD - Regeneration
Event.descriptionHtml:
What might a regenerative economy look like? How can we most gracefully cultivate a thriving coexistence for all life on Earth?  Where might we find or create credible paths towards healthy, prosocial futures?

Perhaps the most difficult problem in software is choosing what to build. While humanity’s technical capabilities are more powerful than ever, this 3 part series is intended to help us create more wholesome economic environments in which we can live well together. We’ll find our breath, connect, play, and explore via a facilitated, interactive workshop series, iterating through small breakout sessions and visual communication.

Participants will discover what regeneration means to the group, listen and identify emergent patterns and systems, and reflect upon our personal agency. These events will be recorded, we’ll be announcing guest speakers, and there will be opportunities to offer your own reflections through scheduled 1:1 interviews along the way.

Preparation

Familiarize yourself with pre-readings here. This is an interactive and participatory experience. You’ll be in small breakouts and be expected to collaborate using a digital whiteboard. Please plan to join with a laptop or desktop and choose a suitable location to participate.

Event.title: Block 7 Interviews
Event.descriptionHtml:
Dear Guides,

We will be conducting several rounds of Interviews covering the KERNEL book from July 12 - Aug 12.

Each day, we will be doing 2 rounds, one hour each. You will be in a zoom-room with 3-4 potential KB7 fellows for each round.

  • Topics for all upcoming Interview Juntos:

    • July 12, Tuesday: Hospitality, Thanksgiving

    • July 12, Tuesday (6PM - 8PM ET): Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • July 14, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • July 15, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    • July 18, Monday: Censorship Resistance, Learn

    • July 20, Wednesday: Giving, Scalability

    • July 21, Thursday: Remember, Lock it Open

    • July 28, Thursday: Conversation, Money Talks

    • July 29, Friday: Finding Lost Paradises, Prosocial Value

    • Aug 1, Monday: The Gift, The Infinite Game

    • Aug 2, Tuesday: Transform, Consensus

    • Aug 3, Wednesday: Meaning, Value

    • Aug 4, Thursday: Intention, Freedom

    • Aug 5, Friday: Listening & Stories, Incentives

    • Aug 8, Monday: Learn how to learn, Censorship Resistance

    • Aug 9, Tuesday: Unbounded Search, The People's Narrative

    • Aug 10, Wednesday: Infinity Games, Playing with Patterns

    • Aug 11, Thursday: Signature Economies

    • Aug 12, Friday: Incentives, Listening

    You can RSVP for as many Interviews you like.

    Note that Dates in the description might slightly differ with the ones on the right and in your calendar because of timezone differences.
